longDescription.effects: +0.7 Tears up.
longDescription.notes:
The Sad Onion was the first item designed by Edmund for the original game The Binding of Isaac, which is probably why it has the item ID 1.
The item's effect is a reference to the fact that when onions are cut, they have a tendency to make people involuntarily cry.

longDescription.effects:
Isaac fires a spread of three tears at once.
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
longDescription.notes:
20/20: Overidden by The Inner Eye.
  20/20 : Shoots 5 tears instead of 3.
Azazel: Fires three short ranged brimstone beams that overlap. Significant increase in tear delay.
 The Forgotten: Triples bones thrown and swung. Significant increase in tear delay.
 Keeper: Fires 6 tears with significantly increased tear delay.
Kidney Stone: Increase number of tears in tear barrage; however, only fires one stone.
Loki's Horns: Only occasionally fires one tear in the other three directions.
Mom's Eye: Only occasionally fires one tear out of the back of Isaac's head.
Monstro's Lung: Adds tears to barrage with a significant increase in tear delay.
Mutant Spider: Overrides The Inner Eye.
  Mutant Spider : Shoots 7 tears instead of 3. No further decrease in fire rate.
The Wiz: Fires two sets of three tears diagonally outwards.

longDescription.effects: Grants homing tears.
longDescription.notes:
20/20/Cursed Eye/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: All tears home in on enemies.
Brimstone: The beam curves towards enemies.
  Azazel : The short-ranged beam can curve with higher range stat.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Tears and split tears are homing.
Dr. Fetus: The bombs slide towards enemies.
 Epic Fetus: Cursor slides towards enemies.
Fate's Reward/Incubus: Familiars get homing tears as well.
Haemolacria: Main tears and burst tears home in on enemies.
Ipecac: Homing explosive shots.
Lead Pencil/Monstro's Lung: All tears in tear barrage are homing.
Marked: Tears will travel in the direction of the cross-hairs until close enough to home in on an enemy.
Mom's Knife: The knife curves towards enemies.
Sprinkler: Sprinkler will fire homing tears.
Strange Attractor: Increases accuracy by drawing enemies towards tears.
Technology: The laser curves towards enemies.
Technology 2: The laser and tears home in on enemies.
Tech X: The laser rings curve towards enemies, resulting in longer contact time and substantial damage increase per ring.

longDescription.effects:
+0.5 damage up.
x1.5 damage multiplier.
longDescription.notes: The x1.5 damage multiplier does not stack with the x1.5 damage multiplier from Magic Mushroom, from the combination of The Book of Belial and Blood of the Martyr, or itself (by using an item such as Diplopia, for example). However, it will stack with any other multipliers, such as Sacred Heart.

longDescription.effects:
Isaac's tears travel a short distance, then reverse direction and return to Isaac.
  The tears are constantly pulled towards Isaac; if Isaac moves after shooting, the tears will always return to him.
+1.5 range
+0.6 shot speed
+1 shot height
longDescription.notes:
Anti-Gravity: The tears will slowly move towards Isaac instead of remaining stationary. Releasing the fire button will launch the tears as usual.
Brimstone: Overrides My Reflection.
  Makes the beam curve when moving. Has the same effect on Azazel's mini-brimstone and doubles the range.
Continuum: If tears cross the border of the room, they will move towards Isaac from their new position rather than crossing back across the border.
Compound Fracture/The Parasite/Cricket's Body: Split tears will move towards Isaac.
Dr. Fetus: Not recommended. The bombs will slide back towards Isaac after having reached a certain distance.
Epic Fetus: Overrides My Reflection.
Euthanasia: Needles from Euthanasia bursts will move towards Isaac.
Flat Stone: Tears bounce away from and then back towards Isaac.
Haemolacria: Range becomes extremely high, making Haemolacria tears follow Isaac for a long time before hitting the ground. Burst tears do not have the boomerang effect.
Ipecac: Not recommended. The explosive tears will begin flying back towards Isaac after having reached a certain distance.
Lachryphagy: Tears will move towards Isaac and can still be fed and burst. Burst tears will also move towards Isaac.
A Lump of Coal: The tears increase in damage as they are pulled towards Isaac.
The Ludovico Technique: The tear will slowly move towards Isaac, and the shot speed increase allows the tear to be moved much faster.
Mom's Knife: No effect, as the knife already has this effect.
Piercing Tears: Despite the piercing effect, tears cannot damage the same enemy multiple times.
Pop!: Tears can still bounce off of each other but will try to return to Isaac.
Proptosis: At base tear size, tears disappear before they can return to Isaac.
Rubber Cement: Isaac's tears will continually be pulled towards him, effectively reducing the chances that tears will bounce.
Spoon Bender: If tears are close enough to an enemy, it will home in and damage them. If not, they will return to Isaac.
Strange Attractor: Not recommended. While it may make it easier to hit enemies, it also makes it much easier for them to be attracted towards Isaac, surrounding him.
Technology: Overrides My Reflection.
  Makes the beam curve when moving.
Technology 2/ Tech.5: Tears return to character and the beams curve when moving.
Tech X: Stat effects of My Reflection remain but the boomerang effect does not.
Tiny Planet: The orbital tears will move faster to stay in orbit around Isaac, making aiming easier.
Trisagion: Makes the beams much longer as they move away from and then back towards Isaac.
Whip Worm: Further increases shot speed, making Isaac's tears travel much farther forward before returning to Isaac.

longDescription.effects:
+1.5 tears.
-17.62 range.
+0.76 tear height.
Tears turn yellow and are fired from Isaac's lower body rather than his head.
longDescription.notes:
Azazel: Lowers range, reduces charge time.
Compound Fracture/ The Parasite: Tears often disappear before being able to split. Split tears also only travel a very short distance.
Cricket's Body: Tears disappear very quickly after being fired and split tears barely travel at all.
Dr. Fetus: Not recommended. Bombs do not travel far, making self damage very likely.
Haemolacria: Does not affect main tear; however, burst tears travel significantly less far.
Kidney Stone: Tear barrage fires a very short distance before disappearing. Does not affect the stone.
A Lump of Coal: Tears still increase in size and damage as they travel; however, the short range limits tear size and damage.
Marked: Tears become orange. Firing rate is increased, Marked's effect is unaffected but range is reduced.
Mom's Knife: The knife turns yellow and the maximum range is significantly reduced.
Monstro's Lung/Lead Pencil: Not recommended. Tear barrage disappears very close to Isaac.
Proptosis: Not recommended. Tears disappear after traveling a very short distance.
Rubber Cement: Tears often disappear before being able to bounce off walls.
Toothpicks: Tears become orange.

longDescription.effects: Increases damage by 1, and turns Isaac's tears into blood tears.
longDescription.notes:
The Book of Belial: Applies an additional 1.5x damage multiplier.
  The x1.5 damage multiplier does not stack with the x1.5 damage multiplier from Magic Mushroom and Cricket's Head .

longDescription.effects:
This item causes many Fly enemies to move slower and alter their behavior toward Isaac.
  The following flies transform into a neutral Black Fly : Attack Fly , Dart Fly , Eternal Fly , and Ring Fly . 
  The following flies retain their form and deal contact damage: Large Attack Fly , Swarm Fly , Hush Fly , Boom Fly , Red Boom Fly , Drowned Boom Fly , Sucker , and Spit . 
  The following flies retain their form and do not deal contact damage: Moter , Level 2 Fly , Full Fly , Pooter , and Super Pooter .
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.notes:
This item can only be obtained from the Shell Game Beggar in the arcade.
Flies spawned by The Husk will not become passive.

longDescription.effects:
Grants one red heart container.
+0.3 Damage Up.
x1.5 Damage Multiplier.
+5.25 Range Up.
+0.3 Speed Up.
+0.5 Tear Height.
Isaac grows in size.
Fully restores all red heart containers.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
 This item belongs to the Stompy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Stompy.
longDescription.notes:
The Magic Mushroom does not give a tears up or luck up despite its quote saying 'All Stats Up!'.
The x1.5 damage multiplier does not stack with the x1.5 damage multiplier from Cricket's Head, from the combination of The Book of Belial and Blood of the Martyr, or itself (by using an item such as Diplopia, for example). However, it will stack with any multipliers not listed here.

longDescription.effects:
Inflicts poison on enemies who make contact with Isaac.
  The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.
   Each poison hit deals damage equal to Isaac's tear damage. 
  Enemies who are killed after they have been inflicted with this type of poison have a 20% chance to drop black hearts .
-0.1 Speed down ( not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated)
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.notes:
The black heart is only dropped if the poison was caused by The Virus. The item's effect doesn't extend to poison tears.
 Black flies are the best source of black hearts, since they can't deal any damage, which means that you can poison them without losing health.
  You can abuse this if you find a Skatole item and a Hive enemy. This will result in an infinite source of black hearts. 
  Although Stonies and Shopkeepers can't be visibly poisoned, they still can drop Black Hearts if destroyed after being touched.
Due to a glitch or patch, some enemies must be moving to receive poison damage. Some enemies pushing against Isaac that are immobile will not take damage, while the poisoned effect will still show up.
  Gnawed Leaf and The Virus can still work if Isaac has a short range orbital such as Cube of Meat or Ball of Bandages , as it will kill enemies pushing against Isaac that are not taking poison damage due to immobility while still dropping black hearts.

longDescription.effects:
+0.6 Speed up.
+5.25 Range up.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.notes: Little Baggy - Collect 2 of either Roid Rage, The Virus, Growth Hormones, Experimental Treatment or Speed Ball.

longDescription.effects: Grants Isaac one red heart container and fully restores Isaac's health.
longDescription.notes: "<3" is the ASCII/Emoticon version of a heart.

longDescription.effects: Gives Isaac two red heart containers and fully restores Isaac's health.
longDescription.notes:
Gives Blue Baby and The Soul 2 Soul Hearts.
Gives The Forgotten 2 Bone Hearts.
No effect on Keeper.

longDescription.effects: Gives the player 99 keys.
longDescription.notes:
Rerolling this item with the D4, D100, Missing No., or a 1 or 6 pip Dice Room will not remove the 99 keys.
This item is very useful for donating to Key Masters.

longDescription.effects: Upon picking up A Dollar, the player's coin count will be set to 99, the maximum possible amount of money.
longDescription.notes:
Picking this item up will automatically unlock Cain.
Multiple Dollars can be dropped in the same run by different slot machines.

longDescription.effects: Grants 10 bombs.
longDescription.notes: Effectively a weaker version of Pyro, which grants 99 bombs instead of 10.

longDescription.effects: Grants flight.
longDescription.notes:
The pickup quote "We all float down here... " is a reference to the Stephen King book 'IT'.
If Scissors are used after picking up Transcendence, Isaac will have no body from which to shoot tears. Only a shadow and orbitals will remain.
This item is used in Challenge #6 (Solar System).
In the original Binding Of Isaac, Transcendence was unlocked by beating Mom's Heart two times instead of three.

longDescription.effects:
Reveals all special rooms on the map, excluding secret rooms and super secret rooms.
The following rooms will be revealed if they exist:
  Boss Room 
  Mini-Boss Room 
  Treasure Room 
  Shop 
  Arcade 
  Challenge Room 
  Boss Challenge Room 
  Curse Room 
  Sacrifice Room 
  Library 
  Vault 
  Dice Room 
  / Bedrooms
longDescription.notes: The Compass will reveal if Greed is present by displaying a mini-boss icon with the shop icon. It might also reveal if Greed is present in the Secret Room, and thus, the location of the Secret Room itself.

longDescription.effects: Grants one full red heart container.
longDescription.notes: In the original Binding Of Isaac, the dog bowl had the name "Max" carved on it. This is a reference to a dog that Edmund McMillen wanted as a child but never got. Edmund McMillen had wanted to name the dog Max.

longDescription.effects: Grants one full red heart container.
Grants Isaac one full red heart container.
Grants Isaac one full red heart container.
longDescription.notes: If an item pool runs out of items, it will only contain Breakfast from that point onwards.

longDescription.effects: Grants a full heart container.
+0.3 Speed
+0.3 Speed

+5.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.

+5.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.

+5.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
+0.7 Tears up.
longDescription.notes:
In the original flash version of The Binding of Isaac, this item was unlocked by default.
This item is likely a reference to the usage of wire coat hangers to perform abortions.

longDescription.effects:
+1 Luck.
Increases chances of winning at Shell Game Beggar and Fortune Teller (independent of the luck stat).
Increases chances of getting a room clearing drop (independent of the luck stat).
longDescription.notes: Lucky Toe: The extra luck-independent chance of room clearing drops from both Lucky Toe and Lucky Foot applies only in a diminished form, unless at zero or negative luck.

longDescription.effects: Grants piercing tears that travel through enemies (but not obstacles) instead of breaking on impact with them.
longDescription.notes:
8 Inch Nails/Blister/Cricket's Head/Flat Worm: Reduces knockback effectiveness of these items.
Dr. Fetus: Bombs travel through enemies. When combined with Ipecac, bombs do not explode upon hitting enemies.
Fire Mind: Tears will continue to pierce enemies while retaining the explosion chance.
Ipecac: Pierces through poop and fireplace, but not enemies.

longDescription.effects:
Steven will chase the player, and then charge until exhausted. This pattern continues throughout the fight.
Smaller Steven will shoot tears whenever the player is exposed.
At about 75% HP (50% HP of Big Steven), they will separate.
longDescription.notes:
Big Steven will continue chasing, charging, and running out of breath.
Small Steven will not stop chasing the player until killed. Be cautious when juggling him, as you could corner yourself between the two.
Both, when killed, will shoot out tears in eight directions.

longDescription.effects:
+1 Damage.
Increases chance for a Devil / Angel Room Door to open when a floor Boss is killed by 10%.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.notes: This item is used in Challenge #4 (Darkness Falls).

longDescription.effects:
Tears are replaced with bombs that explode approximately one second after being fired.
  Each bomb deals 3 times the character's normal tear damage. 
  Each bomb deals 5 times the character's normal tear damage plus a flat 30 damage. The flat 30 is not affected by damage multipliers.
longDescription.notes:
Dr. Fetus overrides multiple tear effect items but benefit from some (but not all) bomb-enhancing effects like Mr. Mega.
  In Afterbirth, many more synergies have been added.
With Dr. Fetus, the range and shot speed stats both affect the velocity at which the bombs are fired out. Delay before explosion is not affected by either.
Dr. Fetus is one of the items that directly affect tear delay.

longDescription.effects:
Pickups (e.g. hearts, coins, keys, bombs, etc.) are attracted to Isaac.
  The attraction enables the item to pass/fly over pits or rocks, but not through Key Blocks. 
  Hearts are only attracted if Isaac could pick them up with his existing heart containers. 
  Batteries act in a similar manner to hearts in that they will only be attracted towards Isaac if his active item isn't fully charged.
A few enemies (like the Horf) are drawn toward Isaac as well.
longDescription.notes: Magneto can attract scared hearts, but they still run away from Isaac.

longDescription.effects: Causes all rooms, excluding the Secret Room and Super Secret Room, to appear on the minimap. Does not reveal contents of rooms.
longDescription.notes:
Blue Map: Reveals both rooms and secret rooms.
The Compass: Reveals rooms and their contents.

Mom's_Eye.shortDescription: Eye in the back of your head

longDescription.effects:
Gives Isaac a chance to shoot a tear out of an eye on the back of his head.
  The chance to shoot a second tear depends on the luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 2 Luck.
longDescription.notes:
Has no effect on Lilith.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.

longDescription.effects: Allows Isaac to walk across gaps one square across by automatically placing a ladder between the two walkable sections. Enemies can not walk over the ladder.
longDescription.notes:
This item is a reference to the Ladder in The Legend of Zelda for the NES.
 This item is used in Challenge #26 (I RULE!).

longDescription.effects: Restores half a red heart for every 13 enemies killed.
longDescription.notes:
As Keeper, health coins can be restored with this item.
As Blue Baby and The Lost, this item has no effect because these characters have no red hearts.

longDescription.effects:
Active items can store an extra level of charge, allowing them to be used twice in one room.
  Extra charges appear in yellow over the normal charge meter.
longDescription.notes:
The Battery does not affect self-recharging activated items.
  Self-recharging active items can charge the yellow meter, allowing Isaac to use them twice immediately.

longDescription.effects: Halves shop prices.
longDescription.notes:
Items sold for 15 pennies will have their price rounded down to 7.
Pickups sold for 5 pennies will have their price rounded up to 3. Red hearts, normally sold for 3 pennies, will have their price rounded up to 2.
Multiple Steam Sales can be obtained via each of the normal drop methods, but doing so has no effect.
  Reduces all shop prices to 0 coins.
   If Isaac has Restock , it is possible to collect an infinite supply of pickups/items. Extremely powerful when combined with Chaos . 
  Steam Sale will cause the Deals with the Devil not to convert the heart type automatically.
 Items have a chance to be discounted further by random sales; for example, a discounted item originally costing 5 coins will then cost 2 coins instead of 3.

longDescription.effects: Replaces tears with a piercing laser with unlimited range, but does not fire over rocks and obstacles.
longDescription.notes: Laser rate of fire is determined by the tears stat. This differentiates the item from Technology 2 which fires a continuous beam, and Tech.5 which has a random fire rate.

longDescription.effects:
Grants charged tears that deal greater damage when fully charged.
  Tear damage scales from approximately 30% damage at minimum charge to 400% damage at full charge.
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
longDescription.notes: Repeatedly pressing a key to fire allows Isaac to fire as quickly as the key is pressed, up to the equivalent of a maxed tears stat. This is not generally recommended, as overall damage per second is greatly reduced.

longDescription.effects:
+1 Damage
+0.4 Speed
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.notes: Little Baggy - Collect 2 of either Roid Rage, The Virus, Growth Hormones, Experimental Treatment or Speed Ball.

longDescription.effects:
+0.3 Speed.
-4.25 Range.
+1.5 Shot Height.
Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
longDescription.notes: Even if the range stat is decreased, the effective range is slightly increased due to the changes to the hidden shot height attribute.

longDescription.effects:
Grants 3 Soul Hearts.
Increases the chance to find The Bible. The item has a chance to appear in any Item Pool.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.notes:
It is possible to find The Bible multiple times in a single run; however, once picked up, it cannot appear again.
This item stacks with the Rosary Bead trinket, further increasing the chance to find The Bible in the Library and Shop.
The approximate chances of finding The Bible in each item pool are:

longDescription.effects: Gives Isaac 25 coins.
longDescription.notes: It has a chance to spawn when urns or shopkeepers are destroyed.

longDescription.effects:
Identifies all pills upon pickup.
Converts some "bad" pills into their "good" counterparts:
  All "stat down" pills into "stat up" pills 
  Bad Trip into Balls of Steel 
  Amnesia into I Can See Forever 
  ??? into Telepills 
  Addicted into Percs! 
  I'm Excited!!! into I'm Drowsy... 
  Paralysis into Pheromones 
  Retro Vision into I can see forever! 
  R U A Wizard? into Power Pill! 
  X-Lax into Something's wrong...
Spawns a pill.
Replenishes 2 red hearts.
Adds 0-2 coins to the payout every time you use the Blood Donation Machine or IV Bag.
longDescription.notes:
The following pill types are neutral and do not have a "good" equivalent, or are otherwise left unchanged by PHD.
  ??? 
   Converted to Telepills 
  Explosive Diarrhea 
  Hematemesis 
  I Found Pills 
  Infested! 
  Infested? 
  One makes you small 
  One makes you larger 
  Paralysis 
   Converted to Pheromones 
  Pheromones 
  Power Pill! 
  Pretty Fly 
  Puberty 
  R U A Wizard? 
   Converted to Power Pill! 
  Re-Lax 
  Telepills
Bad pills already obtained/dropped will be converted to their "good" counterparts.
If PHD is rerolled by the D4 or a Dice Room, pills will be identified on pickup, but negative pills will not be prevented from spawning.
 Performing a RERUN with a character that held PHD will still prevent negative pills from spawning, but will no longer identify pills until used.
As bad pills will turn into good pills, it is possible for two different colored pills to have the same effect.

longDescription.effects: Opens Secret Rooms and Super Secret Rooms automatically.
longDescription.notes: When in The Void, the entrances are not automatically opened or even identified if the room is not yet cleared. Re-entering the room once enemies are killed and/or silver buttons pressed will open the doors normally.

longDescription.effects:
+1 Damage up.
+0.2 Speed up.
Grants one soul heart.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.notes:
The Mark refers to the Mark of the Beast in the end of times prophecies (3 6's arranged in a triskelion). Without this mark, one would not be allowed to buy or sell.
While The Mark's icon shows the 6's facing towards the center, on Isaac's forehead the symbol appears with the 6's facing outwards.
Loki has the Mark of the Beast on his forehead.

longDescription.effects:
+0.5 Damage.
+0.7 Tears.
Grants two Soul Hearts.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.

Grants Flight.
+0.3 Speed Up ( not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated).
longDescription.notes:
Lord of the Pit's icon resembles the Cross of St. Peter.
The wings granted by Lord of the Pit are identical to Azazel's wings.
The item is a reference to a 'Magic: The Gathering' card of the same name featuring a black-winged demonic creature on it, which is the appearance Isaac assumes upon picking up the item.
"The Lord of the Gap" is a name commonly given to Belphegor, the demon of sloth and invention.

longDescription.effects:
Chance to shoot tears four ways like the bosses Loki and Lokii can.
Chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 7 Luck.
longDescription.notes: As she does not fire any tears herself, picking up this item with Lilith is useless.

longDescription.effects:
Adds a chance to shoot slowing tears, reducing speed of enemy movement and any projectile fired by them.
 This item belongs to the Spider Baby set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a humanoid spider.
longDescription.notes:
The slow duration is 2.5 seconds.
The slow effect chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 15 Luck.

longDescription.effects:
+1 damage up.
-0.2 speed and maximum speed down.
+0.2 tears up.
longDescription.notes:
It has a small chance to be dropped from a destroyed tinted rock.
 The speed and tears changes will take effect immediately; without it, they will not immediately change until Isaac's speed or tears stats are updated the next time.
The rock normally only appears once per run but can appear again if Isaac's items are re-rolled with the D4, D100, or a Dice Room.
The rock may also appear twice in the same floor if the player does not pick it up the first time encountered, and then bombs another rock to get it again. However, while the Speed down and Tears up stack, the Damage does not.
Taking the rock in the Boss Rush from a tinted rock in the room will count as taking an item and consequently trigger Boss Rush.

longDescription.effects:
Reveals on map what type of room all rooms adjacent to your current room are (shop, sacrifice room, etc.)
  This also works for secret rooms and super secret rooms .
longDescription.notes: Spelunker Hat makes Isaac glow more strongly in the dark (such as when Curse of Darkness is active).

longDescription.effects: Grants one full heart container as well as two soul hearts.
longDescription.notes: The item is a reference to Super Meat Boy, one of Edmund McMillen's other games.

longDescription.effects:
Grants one full red heart container.
+0.3 Damage.
+0.2 Tears.
+0.25 Range.
+0.3 Speed.
+0.5 Tear Height.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.

Adds a chance to shoot poison tears, dealing damage over time when inflicted.
The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.
  The poison hits twice, dealing a total of double Isaac's damage.
longDescription.notes:
The chance for a tear to be poisoned depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 12 Luck.
Unlike Scorpio, The Common Cold will only inflict poison status when a poison tear is triggered and is therefore strictly inferior.

longDescription.effects:
Tears that deal more than 1.0 damage split into two tears with half damage and half remaining range on impact with obstacles or enemies.
  Damage less than 1.0 causes the tears to simply disappear. 
  The splitting can keep up as long as the tears have range remaining and the damage of the split tears stays above 0.5.
longDescription.notes:
Angelic Prism: All tears split by the prism will burst into split tears when hitting obstacles.
Bob's Rotten Head: Two further explosions appear perpendicular to the head's direction of travel when it blows up.
Compound Fracture: Both tear split effects happen simultaneously.
Continuum/Spectral Tears: When tears pass through solid objects, like rocks, they will split, resulting in many tears shooting out from every rock the original tear passed through.
Cricket's Body: Two groups of this item's four tears, creating eight additional miniature tears on every point of impact instead.
 Dr. Fetus: Bombs split into two bombs upon detonation.
Flat Stone: Every time tears bounce, burst tears spawn.
Lachryphagy: Fed tears split into 12 tears. When tears are minimally fed and hit an obstacle, they will split into 5 Lachryphagy burst tears and Parasite burst tears.
Lead Pencil/Monstro's Lung: All tears in tear barrage will burst into split tears when hitting obstacles or enemies.
The Ludovico Technique: Repeatedly spawns miniature tears when on top of an enemy, greatly increasing damage.
Piercing Tears: Split tears form for each hit as the tears pass through the enemies.
Tiny Planet: The split tears will continue to orbit Isaac, increasing damage potential.
Tractor Beam: The split tears will be forced directly forward, impacting whatever caused the first tear to split. This increases damage immensely.
Trisagion: When beams hit obstacles, the beam will split; the split beams can split again when hitting other obstacles.

longDescription.effects:
Grants 5 bombs.
Gives all of Isaac's bombs increased damage and blast radius.
  Mr. Mega bombs deal 110 damage, while normal bombs deal 60 damage.
When bombs explode, the screen will shake.
longDescription.notes: It is possible to acquire this item more than once by killing multiple Super Wraths on later floors; however, the bomb damage increase doesn't stack.

longDescription.effects: All damage taken is reduced to half a heart.
longDescription.notes:
The damage reduction includes every possible source in the game that would cause more than half a heart of damage:
  The player's bombs and other bombs. 
  Champions . 
  Sacrifice Rooms . 
  Environmental hazards such as Spikes . 
  Self-inflicting damage items: Sharp Plug , Blood Rights , Razor Blade , Kamikaze! and Breath of Life . 
  Every source of damage in The Womb / Utero and beyond, including all enemies, curse rooms , blood donation machines , and Devil Beggars . 
  The "HARD HARD" special seed .
The Wafer does not prevent death (even if the player has more than half a heart) by using the Suicide King card, or using the Bible on the Satan boss fight.
  It also cannot prevent health loss from Devil Room deals or Health Down pills .
Despite The Wafer reducing damage to 1/2 a heart, this does not change the amount of invincibility frames the player would normally get from full/two heart damage sources.
It will not work with Keeper as he cannot have half of a health coin.

longDescription.effects:
Adds 0.04 points of damage for every coin Isaac has.
  The damage caps at +3.96 Damage at 99 coins. 
  Though Isaac can still collect coins if he already has 99, he will not gain any damage bonus from them.
longDescription.notes:
A Dollar: Immediately maxes out damage bonus.
A Quarter: Increases damage by 1.

longDescription.effects:
Adds a chance to shoot petrifying tears, which stop enemies in place and prevent them from moving or attacking.
+0.25 Range up ( not applied until the next time Isaac's range stat is updated).
+0.5 Tear Height ( not applied until the next time Isaac's tear height is updated).
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes:
The activation chance depends on the luck stat, and goes up to around 50% with approximately 20 luck.
Petrifying a Heart also freezes the Mask bound to it.
Petrifying an enemy with a weak zone (Scolex or Carrion Queen) will make the enemy take damage anywhere while it is petrified, making combat significantly easier.

longDescription.effects:
Isaac's tears are replaced by a knife that pierces enemies and can travel through obstacles. Holding down the fire button increases its range and power.
  The knife can hurt enemies while Isaac is holding it. 
  The knife deals 2x Isaac's damage while held and 6x damage at the furthest possible point of its arc, regardless of the actual maximum range stat.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes:
The knife can be held and fired diagonally. Firing the knife diagonally requires a frame perfect input. However, this can be done easily with a controller's analog stick or with Analog Stick.
The knife will not work in challenges with the Blindfolded effect.

longDescription.effects: Grants spectral tears that travel through obstacles (but not enemies) instead of breaking on impact with them.
longDescription.notes: The Parasite: When tears pass through a solid objects, like rocks, they will split, resulting in many tears shooting out from every rock the original tear passed through.

longDescription.effects:
Fully charges the current activated item upon first pickup.
If the current activated item has a recharge time of more than 1 bar, then it will grant 1 bar of charge whenever the item is activated.
If the current activated item has a recharge time of 1 bar, then it will change the item to have a timed recharge of 15 seconds. The recharging of the item only triggers so long as there are enemies present in the room in any fashion. Empty rooms do not cause recharging to start.
  An enemy spawned in a cleared room will also cause recharging to start.
If the current activated item has a real-world unit-based recharge time, the effect of the 9 Volt may vary.
longDescription.notes: Enemies generated through a slot machine, shell game beggar, or breaking pots/skull will restart the charging process, even though a cleared room still counts as cleared if enemies are spawned in it.

longDescription.effects: Taking damage summons a familiar that chases enemies for the remainder of the current room, dealing 2 damage per tick or 4 damage per second.
longDescription.notes: Eve starts with this item by default.

longDescription.effects:
Isaac's tears are replaced with a charged blood laser beam. The beam is piercing and spectral, dealing damage to all enemies and ignoring all obstacles in its path.
  The laser deals damage equal to Isaac's damage each tick, and ticks a total of 13 times. 
  Tears down: Delay * 3.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.notes:
Azazel starts the game with a short-ranged, slower charging version of Brimstone. Picking up Brimstone with him will give him the long ranged version. Without the long ranged version, his mini-brimstone won't have enough length to use any homing items. His mini-brimstone's range can be increased with range up items or pills.
If multiple Brimstones are picked up (via Diplopia, Crooked Penny or on a victory lap), then another beam is added, with no increase in charge time.
  Although extremely unlikely, a total of 16 blood beams can be on screen at a time (including beams shot with tear-increasing items, such as 20/20 ). If another Brimstone is picked up, the beams' span will widen.

longDescription.effects:
Gives the player a full red heart container and restores 5 red hearts.
+0.3 speed up.
longDescription.notes: This item can be found and picked up multiple times when generated by a Blood Donation Machine.

longDescription.effects:
+1.7 Tears.
+0.3 Speed.
Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit.
Reduces damage using the following formula: (Damage Ups from other items * 0.9) - 0.4.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
longDescription.notes:
There are two collectible items in the game named Odd Mushroom; you can tell them apart from the sprites.
This item affects damage differently than other items in the game. Instead of multiplying your damage stat, it directly alters the total added damage from other items. In practice, this means this item reduces your damage significantly if you have no items that grant extra damage (x0.72), but won't have as strong of an impact as you collect more 'damage up' items.

longDescription.effects:
Gives Isaac one red heart container.
+0.3 Damage.
+0.25 Range.
+0.5 Shot Height.
-0.1 Speed.
Increases Isaac's size.
 This item belongs to the Fun Guy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking mushroom.
longDescription.notes: There are two collectible items in the game named Odd Mushroom; you can tell them apart from the sprites.

longDescription.effects:
Increases damage by 1.5 and speed by 0.3 while Isaac has half of a red heart or less.
On Eve, the item has the following extra effects:
  The item is activated at one red heart or less. 
  Her damage multiplier increases from 0.75 to 1.0 when active.
longDescription.notes:
The effect is removed after leaving a room with more than half a heart (one full heart for Eve).
The effect may be not be immediately applied if Isaac has lost red hearts without taking damage; the effect will activate upon entering a new room.
The effect is always active for characters without red heart containers such as ??? and The Lost, though other characters can also lose their heart containers through devil deals or items like Guppy's Paw, Abaddon, or Health Down pill.
III - The Empress grants a similar effect to Whore of Babylon for the current room which does stack with Whore of Babylon.
  Stacking The Empress on Whore of Babylon either via multiple cards or multiple activations of Blank Card increases damage by number of uses squared , e.g. +1.5 * 2 * 2 total damage bonus for using the card on top of activated Whore of Babylon.
Upon obtaining the Whore of Babylon effect, a popup displaying the text "What a horrible night to have a curse" appears on-screen. This can be disabled in the game options.
 As Keeper cannot have half of a health coin, this item has no effect on him.
 As the Forgotten, the effect will be applied at one half full bone heart.

longDescription.effects:
Grants 5 bombs.
Bombs slowly home in on enemies.
longDescription.notes: This item can make bombing out of rooms difficult, as the bombs may slide towards enemies and away from the door.

longDescription.effects:
Adds 2 empty red heart containers.
-0.2 speed and maximum speed.
Heals half a red heart.
longDescription.notes: This item is used in Challenge #5 (The Tank).

longDescription.effects: Tears gain a flat damage bonus based on how far they travel. This starts at +0 and increases to about +6 at a standard room's width (but can go higher).
longDescription.notes: The item has somewhat of an opposite effect of the item Proptosis, which makes Isaac deal more damage at close range. Proptosis is based on a shrinking multiplier instead of an increasing flat bonus, however.

longDescription.effects:
Grants a 1/3 chance of replacing a pickup with a normal chest or gold chest, but also a 1/3 chance to replace it with nothing at all.
This item belongs to the Guppy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Guppy.
longDescription.notes: Due to any found chests containing Items while in The Chest or The Dark Room, Guppy's Tail can be a good way to quickly stack up more upgrades before facing the final boss.

longDescription.effects:
Grants one full heart container.
+0.3 damage.
longDescription.notes: "Stigmata" is a term used by Catholic priests to designate wounds, sores, etc. found at the same locations on the body as those Jesus sustained during his crucifixion (e.g. palms, feet).

longDescription.effects:
Allows two different trinkets to be carried at once.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes:
Tick: Lets you gain the benefits of the item without losing your only trinket slot.
  You cannot replace the Tick with The Match Stick once it is picked up, as it will only occupy the second trinket slot.

longDescription.effects:
Grants 5 bombs.
Grants all of Isaac's bombs a poison effect.
 This item belongs to the Bob set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Bob.
longDescription.notes: A bomb under the effects of Bob's Curse.

longDescription.effects:
Spawns seven random coins around Isaac.
  These coins may be any normal type with the usual chances: pennies, nickels, dimes lucky pennies or sticky nickels.

Once per room, when Isaac is reduced to his last half Heart (either red, soul, or black), the aura around his head temporarily vanishes and he is granted one Soul Heart.
  After re-entering a room, the ability can be triggered again.
longDescription.notes:
If the scapular is activated and you're already at your last half heart, the scapular won't trigger, even if you take fatal damage.
Using a Blood Donation Machine will trigger Scapular once you reach one half heart. Leaving the room afterwards and then re-entering resets Scapular, allowing you to donate blood further using Soul Hearts. Repeating this process after every Scapular activation will allow you to farm coins from the Blood Donation Machine until it breaks.
  This can also be done with a Devil Beggar to eventually get an item from its pool .
Scapular allows you to freely farm Sacrifice Rooms. If performing a sacrifice reduces you to half a heart, Scapular triggers and Isaac will gain a soul heart. Just exit and re-enter the Sacrifice Room and perform another sacrifice. You will lose a soul heart and then immediately regain it. Repeat as necessary.
 Scapular does not charge between waves in Greed Mode, though it can still be recharged by moving between rooms.
Does not work with The Lost or Keeper, as they cannot reach the required heart value.

longDescription.effects:
+0.3 Speed up.
+0.2 Shot speed up.
 This item belongs to the Spun set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a buff berserker.
longDescription.notes: Little Baggy - Collect 2 of either Roid Rage, The Virus, Growth Hormones, Experimental Treatment or Speed Ball.

longDescription.effects:
1-3 blue flies randomly spawn whenever Isaac takes damage.
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.notes:
Fish Tail: Doubles number of flies spawned.
Hive Mind: Flies are bigger and deal double damage.

longDescription.effects:
Replaces tears with explosive and poisoning projectiles fired in an arc.
Tears down - (Delay * 2) + 10
+13 Shot Height
+40 flat damage (See Effective Damage)
 This item belongs to the Bob set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Bob.
longDescription.notes:
As Ipecac's explosion range does not scale with tear size, with enough tear size increasing items (e.g. Death's Touch), it can become nearly impossible to hit enemies with Ipecac's explosions.
Only enemies directly hit by the Ipecac tear will be applied poisoning; the resulting explosion won't apply poisoning to enemies hit by it.
Ipecac's flat damage upgrade does not increase tear size like standard damage upgrades.
Ipecac's damage bonus does not apply to Burn or Poison fully; only +4 is applied to their damage per tick.
Character damage multipliers do not apply to Ipecac's flat bonus.
Using Ipecac in a Crawl Space will cause the tear to bounce off the ceiling, bounce off the floor at a low height, and eventually explode. The same applies with using it on a Crawl Space wall.

longDescription.effects: Adds a chance to shoot a tooth instead of a tear, which deals greater damage (x3.2) than regular tears.
longDescription.notes: The chance to fire a tooth depends on the luck stat. At base luck (0), the chance is 10%. It goes up to 100% at 9 luck (around 10% more chance per luck up).

longDescription.effects:
Tears have a 1/6 chance of spawning allied blue flies when they hit an enemy.
This item belongs to the Beelzebub set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a giant humanoid fly.
longDescription.notes:
Because the Guppy transformation includes the guaranteed ability to spawn flies on hit, the Mulligan's effect is nullified. This means individual tears cannot spawn more than one fly per hit.
This item does not work for Lilith since the Incubus tears do not count for her own tears.
Items and trinkets that increase tear firing rate synergize well with the Mulligan.
This item is not affected by Luck.

longDescription.effects:
Replaces the character's right eye tears with an unlimited range piercing laser which fires continuously.
x0.65 Damage multiplier.
The laser deals 20% of Isaac's damage per tick, compounding with the damage down.
longDescription.notes:
Tear delay is effectively doubled, as Isaac will do a bit of the animation to fire a right eye tear, but no tear will come out.
Charged shots are not affected by the effective tear delay down, as they don't use the alternative left eye/right eye fire scheme.
As Cain can only fire tears from his right eye, Technology 2 will replace his tears altogether, unless he has Technology or a charged attack.
Because Lilith is blindfolded and relies on herIncubus, the only effect gained from Technology 2 is the damage down.
Unlike Technology, Technology 2 doesn't override Azazel-inherent Brimstone and the laser can be fired while the Brimstone is charged.
  Technology wraps around Brimstone beams and does not override Azazel's Brimstone.

longDescription.effects:
Isaac fires a spread of four tears at once.
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
 This item belongs to the Spider Baby set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a humanoid spider.
longDescription.notes:
The Forgotten: Quadruples bones thrown and swung. Significant increase in tear delay.
Loki's Horns: Only occasionally fires one tear in the other three directions.
Mom's Eye: Only occasionally fires one tear out of the back of Isaac's head.
The Wiz: Four shots are fired diagonally out of each eye.
  Fires three shots diagonally out of each eye.

longDescription.effects: +2 flat damage to tears fired from Isaac's left eye.
longDescription.notes:
The damage bonus is unaffected by both positive and negative damage multipliers.
Cain has a 50% chance of firing a shot with the effects of Chemical Peel whenever he fires.
Blood Clot applies to the same eye.

longDescription.effects: When Isaac is hit, his active item gains 1 room's worth of charge.
longDescription.notes:
Dull Razor + Schoolbag: Using the Dull Razor activates the Habit, but this does not restore its own charge, only that of the item in the Schoolbag.
Yum Heart + 9 Volt: Isaac could potentially become invincible on early floors or with The Wafer, losing only half a heart per three hits taken.

longDescription.effects:
Damage increases as Isaac receives damage. The damage increase stays for the whole floor, but resets upon entering a new floor.
  The first three times Isaac is hit, his damage is increased by 0.5. 
  The next three times Isaac is hit, his damage is increased by 33%. 
  Any damage taken past the sixth hit does not further increase damage.
Isaac becomes redder as his damage increases.
longDescription.notes:
Samson starts with this item by default.
If Forget Me Now or a 5-pip Dice Room is used, the damage boost will reset.

longDescription.effects:
Grants spectral tears and flight.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.notes:
It is the Devil Room equivalent of the Dead Dove.
The changed texture of the player's body is the same as The Lost's, but recolored.
Lord of the Pit costs the same amount of Red Hearts as Spirit of the Night, while only granting flight and increased speed. Its strongly recommended to take Spirit of the Night if the player has the choice.

longDescription.effects:
Grants an extra life.
  Isaac will respawn as ??? in the previous room.
longDescription.notes:
Because characters are respawned as???, if Azazel or The Lost are resurrected by this item, they will lose the ability to fly unless they picked up items granting such abilities.
  Azazel will also lose his short-ranged Brimstone. 
  If Lilith is resurrected she will lose Incubus and fire as any other character instead.
Like other items that grant an extra life, but respawn Isaac as a different character, all Completion Marks earned from the moment of death onwards will count towards the new character, not the old.

longDescription.effects: Grants a chance to trigger the Book of Shadows effect upon taking damage, creating a shield that nullifies all types of damage for 7 seconds.
longDescription.notes:
The base chance of creating the protective shield is 20%
The activation chance of this item depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.
The shield negates health loss from Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars.
Does not prevent heart container loss from Health Down Pill or Devil Room deals.
Does not prevent damage from IV Bag.

longDescription.effects:
+1 Damage.
+23% Shot Speed.
longDescription.notes:
A Cat o' Nine Tails is a multi-tailed whip commonly used in physical punishment and torture.
Unlike in Rebirth, in the original game Cat-O-Nine-Tails was merely a shot speed up and was widely considered by the community to be one of the worst items in the game.

longDescription.effects:
Isaac's tears are replaced with guided missiles, like those used by the Doctor's Remote.
  Missiles deal 20 times Isaac's damage.
longDescription.notes:
Missiles benefit from most bomb-enhancing effects.
Epic Fetus overrides most items in the game and has the highest priority of all of them, over Brimstone and Mom's Knife.
On PC, using the mouse and keyboard when obtaining this item can be helpful due to the ability to precisely target a specific area in the room, avoiding the sensitivity of a joystick or the limited directions of the arrow keys.
Isaac's tear delay determines how quickly a new missile or missile set can be fired after the previous one has landed. Barring very high tear delay, this has little effect on damage rate due to the delay of the missiles themselves.

longDescription.effects:
Greatly increased damage: (Damage + 4) * 2
Tears down: (Delay * 2.1) + 3
If a tear kills an enemy, the tear travels on with the leftover damage.
longDescription.notes:
Brimstone: Greatly increases damage and charge time.
Chocolate Milk: Greatly increases damage of each shot. Charge time seems unaffected.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Euthanasia/The Parasite: When split tears kill an enemy, they can continue to travel with leftover damage.
Epic Fetus: Isaac fires less frequent missiles that do massive damage.
Lachryphagy: Increases tear delay and greatly increases how big the fed tear can grow.
Mom's Knife: Massively increased damage while decreasing charge rate.
Piercing tears: Since tears go through enemies instead of disappearing on contact with one, they do not decay in damage.

longDescription.effects:
Grants a chance (around 50%) of converting any red hearts pickups into soul hearts instead.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.notes: The mitre is a bishop's ceremonial headdress.

longDescription.effects:
Grants one full Heart Container.
+0.16 shot speed.
longDescription.notes:
The baby attached to Isaac's face is similar in appearance to It Lives.
Stem cells are a special type of cell that can transform into any other cell, and are also what makes up an embryo in the first stages of pregnancy.

longDescription.effects: Grants flight and one Eternal Heart.
longDescription.notes: Taking this item as Keeper will grant flight but will not grant any blue flies in place of the Eternal Heart.

longDescription.effects:
When taking damage, Isaac farts, dealing poison damage to all enemies in range.
  The initial fart deals 5 damage and the poison deals 21 damage over time.
   The damage over time is Isaac's base damage for 6 ticks.
longDescription.notes: Second Hand: The poison duration is not increased.

longDescription.effects:
x2.3 damage multiplier.
+1 flat damage.
+4.125 range.
+0.75 tear height.
-0.4 tears.
-25% shot speed.
Grants homing tears.
Grants homing bombs (the effect of Bobby-Bomb).
Grants one heart container.
Replenishes all red hearts.
longDescription.notes:
Sacred Heart has the highest damage multiplier of all passive items.
Although this item increases range, the reduction of shot speed results in a slight decrease in effective range, not accounting for homing.

longDescription.effects:
Grants flight and one full heart container.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.notes:
This is based on the grail Jesus drank out of in the Last Supper, and the myth that says whoever drinks from it will be blessed.
 This item is used in Challenge #30 (The Guardian).

longDescription.effects:
Grants spectral tears and flight.
 This item belongs to the Seraphim set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.
longDescription.notes:
It is the Angel Room equivalent of Spirit of the Night.
Useless for The Lost and Azazel, who have spectral tears and flight by default.

longDescription.effects:
+1 health
+0.3 damage
+0.2 tears
+0.2 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0)
+0.5 range
+1 tear height
Fills all red heart containers.
longDescription.notes: This item is a reference to one of Edmund McMillen's previous games, Super Meat Boy.

longDescription.effects: Sets Isaac's bomb count to 99.
longDescription.notes: Instead of immediately picking up Pyro, it is more efficient to first use the bombs already in Isaac's possession.

longDescription.effects:
Grants Isaac random tear effects. The possible effects are:
  20/20 
  Ball of Tar 
  Dark Matter 
  Death's Touch 
  Fire Mind 
  Iron Bar 
  Mom's Contacts 
  My Reflection 
  Mysterious Liquid 
  Number One 
  Ouija Board 
  Proptosis 
  Sagittarius 
  Scorpio 
  Speed Ball 
  Spoon Bender 
  The Inner Eye 
  Tough Love
 The type of randomized tear is determined upon entering a room.
 The type of randomized tear changes every 23 seconds. The item appears to select two tear effects at once, perhaps staggering the times at which each of those effects change.
longDescription.notes:
If a run is quit, and then continued, 3 Dollar Bill will have a new random tear effect for the current room.
 The Proptosis effect is bugged for 3 Dollar Bill, and will only fire half the range it would normally (damage is increased normally).
 Combining with the Rainbow Worm trinket, tears become very chaotic, sometimes hazardous but very entertaining.
 Unlike Fruit Cake, which can only modify individual tears, 3 Dollar Bill can modify stats as well.

longDescription.effects:
Grants Isaac one red heart container.
+0.3 Damage up.
longDescription.notes:
This item is a reference to Bonk's Adventure.
The throbbing vein on Isaac's head is commonly used in comics to display the emotion of anger on a character's face.

longDescription.effects:
+0.16 Shot speed.
Upon pickup, drops a random tarot card on the ground nearby.
longDescription.notes: Isaac appears to be wearing a fortune teller's head-dress upon picking up the item. This most likely refers to the Magic 8 Ball's association with fortune telling or advice seeking.

longDescription.effects:
Upon pickup, four random pills will spawn around Isaac.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes: Starter Deck: Drops four cards/runes rather than pills.

longDescription.effects:
+0.4 Tears.
Spawns two soul hearts
longDescription.notes: Squeezy appears to be a Panic Pete squeeze toy.

longDescription.effects:
+0.5 Damage up.
+0.25 Range up.
+0.5 Tear height.
longDescription.notes: Jesus juice is slang for the red wine used in Holy Communion, which is supposed to signify the blood of Jesus. When children take communion, instead of letting them have wine, most churches will let them have grape juice instead, which is why the item is a box of grape juice.

longDescription.effects:
Spawns:
  1 coin 
  1 key 
  1 bomb 
  1 heart 
  1 card/rune 
  1 pill 
  1 trinket
longDescription.notes:
The Box will not always spawn the default pickups.
  Instead of a bomb, it could drop a troll bomb, a 1+1 bomb, or a Gold Bomb. 
  This is also true for hearts (1+1 Hearts), coins (nickel, dime), and keys (key ring).

longDescription.effects:
Grants two keys.
Generates additional pickups from chests.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes:
Mom's Key is the first item, by ID number, that was not carried over from Wrath of the Lamb.
The appearance of Mom's Key is a reference to Bowser's boss key in Super Mario 64 as well as the Boss Key in various Legend of Zelda games.

longDescription.effects:
Gives a chance to shoot charming tears, causing enemies to temporarily fight on Isaac's side.
  The charming effect depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes:
Brimstone: Laser beams charm enemies more consistently due to their tick rate.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Chance for tears and split tears to charm. If the main tear has the charm effect, the split tears will too.
Haemolacria: Chance for tears and split tears to charm. If the main tear charms, the split tears will too.
Lachryphagy: If a charm tear is fed, all burst tears can charm. If a normal tear is fed, the burst tears cannot charm.
The Ludovico Technique: The tear will occasionally change color and can charm.

longDescription.effects:
+0.3 Damage.
Adds a chance to shoot concussive tears, causing enemies to walk around randomly.
longDescription.notes: Concussive tear effect depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.

longDescription.effects:
Upon contact with enemies, deals damage equal to the number of coins Isaac has.
  Damage is dealt up to twice per second per enemy.
Freezes and turns enemies into gold upon contact with Isaac.
  Enemies killed while in this state will drop 1-4 pennies .
longDescription.notes:
With Midas' Touch, some effects that create poop may instead create golden poop (see Synergies for details).
When used against Mom, Mom's foot can usually be hit and will be turned into gold without the player taking damage.
When used against Satan, Satan's foot will be turned into gold and receive a lot of damage.
 When used against Ultra Greed, his armor will be partially impaired to a 25% efficiency.
Spawning Multiplayer Babies while the player has Midas' Touch will give the Midas' Touch effects (freeze on touch + damage) to the baby itself. This can be abused, considering the baby's invincibility frames upon spawning:
  Spawn the baby using the Enter key. It is invincible for a short period of time. 
  During this period, stay in contact with enemies to freeze them and damage them.
This can be used to gather 99 coins very quickly, and in turn, deal massive damage with Midas' Touch damage component.

longDescription.effects: Grants a chance to drop a random Coin, Bomb, Key, or Heart whenever Isaac takes damage.
longDescription.notes: Fanny Pack can drop Soul Hearts, Bone Hearts, and Eternal Hearts but not Black Hearts

longDescription.effects:
If Isaac's current activated item has no charges, attempting to activate the item fully recharges it in exchange for two hearts of Isaac's health.
  If the item has any charges, the Sharp Plug will not work.
longDescription.notes:
If Isaac has less than two black or soul hearts, it will remove them but will not remove any red hearts.
The Lost does not benefit from this item unless they have a respawn because their active item's charge will not refill if the Holy Mantle effect activates. Sharp Plug only activates upon receiving actual damage.
 When used by Keeper, it will only drain one coin heart.

longDescription.effects:
+1 Damage.
Increases the chance for champion enemies to appear by 15%.
longDescription.notes:
While more champions likely mean a tougher run, players will also profit from a higher amount of Pickups available to them, thanks to many champions dropping items upon death.
 The chance for champions to appear does not increase in The Void.

longDescription.effects:
Gives the player 5 bombs.
Bombs now cloud up the screen on detonation, briefly confusing and dealing 10 damage to all enemies in the room.
longDescription.notes:
Butt Bombs heal Brownie, Dangle, and Dingle.
  The Butt Bomb effect on Dr. Fetus or Epic Fetus does not cause healing, but normal bombs still do.

longDescription.effects:
Upon pickup, Isaac gets a small brown ringtail.
After standing still and not pressing the move or attack buttons for one second, Isaac will turn into an invincible statue.
  Using bombs and active items will remove the invincibility state. 
  Bombs can be placed while stationary and safely be stood on until they blow up if no other inputs are done after placing the bomb.
longDescription.notes: My Little Unicorn/The Gamekid/Unicorn Stump: Statue form can activate while invulnerable.

longDescription.effects:
Spawns 1-2 friendly blue spider(s) upon taking damage.
 This item belongs to the Spider Baby set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a humanoid spider.
longDescription.notes: Essentially Infestation's spider equivalent.

longDescription.effects:
Grants Isaac a permanent 50% chance to resurrect on death.
  Resurrection leaves Isaac at 1/2 of a red heart . 
  Guppy's Collar takes priority over all other resurrection items when activated.
This item belongs to the Guppy set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Guppy.
longDescription.notes:
This item is a tribute to Edmund's cat Guppy.[1]
This item may also be a reference to the Schrdinger's Cat thought experiment.
It is possible to obtain two collars by finding one in a red chest, without picking it up, and then finding another collar in a different red chest. However, this does not have any additional effects and does not count towards transforming into Guppy.
Resurrecting in a Curse Room may trap Isaac if he has no way of recovering health or exiting them without losing health.

longDescription.effects:
Gives Isaac's tears a shield surrounding them, allowing the player to block enemy shots.
  Isaac's shots are destroyed upon contact with an enemy's shot. 
  Affects every familiar's tears. 
  No longer affects any familiar's tears besides Fate's Reward and Incubus .
-16% Shot Speed.
longDescription.notes:
Anti-Gravity: Placing many tears around Isaac creates a safe zone, especially with larger tears.
Brimstone/Technology/Technology 2: Beam/laser destroys projectiles, although only during its damage tick interval. The projectiles are not instantly destroyed when they touch the beam/laser.
Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Split tears will be shielded. The Parasite's split tears will not appear to have shields.
Eye of Belial: Piercing through a projectile will trigger Eye of Belial's double damage and homing effect. Belial tears will still block shots.
 The Forgotten: Enemy shots may be reflected with melee attacks. The damage of the reflected shots depends on their size, with standard enemy shots dealing 3.5 points.
The Ludovico Technique: Can block an infinite amount of enemy shots if the tear is placed on top of a monster. The projectiles that they attempt to shoot will be immediately destroyed.
Mom's Knife: The knife will destroy projectiles in its path without being affected.
Piercing tears: The tears can pass through multiple enemy projectiles. This means that one tear can hurt the enemy and block its projectiles.
Polyphemus: Enemy shots are treated like enemies with 10 health, which are deducted from the Polyphemus tear. If it has strength remaining afterwards, it will continue on.
Sinus Infection/Nose Goblin: Tears that stick to enemies will block shots, and will not be destroyed in the process.
Soy Milk: The constant stream of tears will cut through any complex attack patterns with ease.
Tech X: The rings block enemy shots.
Trisagion: Beams will block shots and continue on.

longDescription.effects:
Upon taking damage, Isaac leaves a trail of red creep that damages enemies until he leaves the room.
+5 range.
longDescription.notes:
The effects of this item do not stack if multiple copies of the item or its effects are acquired; Isaac only gets the range bonus once.
Lazarus, or anyone holding Lazarus' Rags, is resurrected with this item upon his first death.
  After Challenge 31: Backasswards is beaten, Lazarus will start with Anemic, and Lazarus Risen will have its +5 range and creep trail effect permanently active, regardless of whether he actually possesses the item.

longDescription.effects:
A Devil Room / Angel Room Door will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding the first floor and floors after Utero II/Womb II/Scarred Womb II.
  The spawned door will not disappear when leaving and re-entering the boss room.
longDescription.notes:
The precise effect involves setting the Devil Room Chance to 100%, regardless of other effects.
  Even if taken after a boss is killed, Goat Head will force a Devil / Angel Room Door to spawn on that floor.
Accepting a deal with the devil will prevent any Angel Rooms from appearing, meaning that Isaac needs to acquire the Goat Head in a Curse Room, Golden Chest, Red Chest, or with Credit Card in order to allow Angel Rooms to open.
 Goat Head and The Book of Belial are the only items that will ensure Angel/Devil Rooms on every floor between Basement I and Utero II.
 Goat Head will not force a Devil / Angel Room Door to open if the Boss Fight was in a narrow room.
 Goat Head has no effect in Greed Mode. Because of this, it is removed from every item pool in Greed Mode.

longDescription.effects:
+1 Damage.
Grants 3 Black Hearts.
longDescription.notes: When purchased at a Devil Room by ??? (or another character who has lost all heart containers) this item effectively converts 3 soul hearts (or fewer, depending on current health) into 3 black hearts, increasing damage at no downside.

longDescription.effects:
Allows Isaac to spawn friendly spiders when firing tears.
Heals Isaac for 1 red heart upon pickup.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes:
The spiders are spawned when Isaac is shooting, and up to 5 spiders can be spawned in the same time. More spiders can be spawned if the previous ones died.
The spider spawning chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.
This item does not work for Lilith, since Incubus tears do not count as her own tears.
Spiders can be spawned in rooms without enemies.

longDescription.effects:
Grants one full Heart Container when picked up.
Isaac has a chance to regenerate half of a red heart every one minute of gameplay.
longDescription.notes:
The regeneration can happen multiple times in the same room, so there is no need to move between rooms to continue regeneration.
It is possible to regenerate all missing hearts by simply standing in the same room for a while. Players may want to take a short break with the game not paused in order to regenerate all of their health.
Regeneration does not occur when standing in a Crawl Space.
 Regeneration occurs with Keeper; it will restore a full health coin for him.
 Regeneration occurs with The Forgotten, restoring a third of a bone heart.
Regeneration will not occur for ???, as he only has soul hearts.

longDescription.effects:
Grants the player an empty heart container.
Adds a chance of dropping a red heart whenever Isaac takes damage.
longDescription.notes: Old Bandage's Red Heart drop chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 50% at 29 Luck.

longDescription.effects:
Upon exploding, Bombs shoot 10 tears off in every direction, similar to Tammy's Head. The tears are affected by any tear modifiers Isaac has on his own tears.
Grants five bombs.
longDescription.notes: The tears generated by the bombs can push other bombs. Dropping multiple Sad Bombs is not advised since they could be pushed near you.

longDescription.effects:
Makes tears bounce off walls, enemies and environmental objects.
  Tears that bounce off of enemies bounce in random directions, whereas tears that bounce off of walls and other objects bounce directly back. 
  Tears bounce off bombs.
longDescription.notes:
Brimstone: Overrides Rubber Cement.
  Brimstone bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage. 
  Azazel's Brimstone will continue to full length after bouncing, but will deal half of damage. 
  Azazel's Brimstone will now no longer continue to full length after bouncing, and instead bounce as a regular mini-Brimstone.
Bob's Rotten Head: The bomb bounces back at the player upon hitting an obstacle.
Continuum: Overridden by Rubber Cement; tears will still bounce off of walls and obstacles.
 The Forgotten: No effect on the skeleton form's attacks.
Homing Tears: Tears will bounce off enemies and home back in, but to deal damage to that enemy again they must bounce off a wall.
Ipecac: Tears will bounce off of walls, but not off of enemies.
Jacob's Ladder: Tears don't generate arcs when hitting obstacles.
Lost Contact: Tears will bounce off of enemy tears.
The Ludovico Technique: Overrides Rubber Cement.
Mom's Knife: Overrides Rubber Cement.
The Parasite: Tears will bounce off of walls without splitting, but split and bounce when hitting enemies. The split tears and the original one will bounce off everything.
Piercing Tears: Tears will bounce off enemies instead of going straight through them, but the tears can still damage enemies such as Knights that are normally invulnerable from the front.
Sinus Infection: Boogers stick to enemies, but otherwise they bounce normally.
Spectral Tears: Overridden by Rubber Cement.
  Tears pass through obstacles but bounce off walls.
Sulfuric Acid: Overridden by Rubber Cement.
Technology / Technology 2: Overrides Rubber Cement.
  Laser bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage.
Tiny Planet: Tears no longer fly over obstacles but instead bounce very quickly along them, appearing to "vibrate".
  Tears pass through obstacles but coast along walls, trying to maintain the circular trajectory.

longDescription.effects:
Holding the fire buttons causes tears to hover in midair. When released, the tears will all shoot in the direction they were originally fired.
  If the fire buttons are not released, the tears will fire on their own after a while.
-2 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
longDescription.notes:
Gravitational effects, such as Mega Fatty's inhalation or a Gaping Maw will pull floating tears toward them.
The range attribute only affects the lifespan of the tears after they have been released.
Hovering tears can damage monsters like Knights or Mask of Infamy from the front, even if they don't have the piercing effect.

longDescription.effects:
+5 bombs
All explosions heal Isaac for one red heart instead of damaging him. If Isaac has no red heart containers or full health, no damage is taken.
longDescription.notes:
Makes the player immune to Mom's, Satan's, and other enemies' stomp attacks, making those fights substantially less difficult.
  Due to the immunity to Mom's stomping attack, Mom's Toenail has improved usefulness.
Makes the player immune to The Cage's, The Adversary's, and Mega Satan's rock wave attack.
The item is unable to produce Soul Hearts, Black Hearts, or Eternal Hearts, making Pyromaniac a little less effective if used with ??? or The Lost. However, these characters still gain immunity to explosions.
Makes the player immune to fires left behind by enemies and their hot bombs, as well as projectiles from Red and Purple Fireplaces but not the fireplaces themselves.
 Ultra Greed's second form in Greedier Mode uses explosive attacks almost exclusively. As a result, Pyromaniac makes characters nearly invulnerable against him.

longDescription.effects:
When Isaac's normal tears disappear (either from hitting the ground or hitting something else), they spawn 4 smaller tears.
  Each smaller tear deals half of Isaac's normal damage.
Slightly increases the size of the tear.
-10 range
-1 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
longDescription.notes:
Any status effect carrying tears: split tears will carry the same status effect.
If Isaac has less than 10 range, the split tears appear but cannot actually cause damage before hitting the floor.
  Cain , Lazarus and Samson have lower starting range and are particularly susceptible. 
  Tear height has no effect on this downside.

longDescription.effects:
Whenever Isaac takes damage, there is a chance that a Soul Heart or a Black Heart might spawn.
Enemies have a chance to drop a Half Red Heart after being killed.
longDescription.notes: Gimpy's Soul Heart drop chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 50% at 22 Luck.

longDescription.effects: Grants a full red heart container, a soul heart, and a black heart.
longDescription.notes:
This is a reference to the iconic card of the same name from Magic: the Gathering, a collectible card game Edmund McMillen played since his childhood.
  Its powerful effect of producing three Mana of any color is reflected by the ingame item's effect of adding three hearts of different colors to the player's health. 
  The fact that it's one of the rarest and most expensive commercially released cards in the game might also be referenced by the fact that it's a relatively hard item to come across, being only a rare find exclusively in secret rooms .

longDescription.effects:
Adds 3 coins on pickup.
When Isaac takes damage 1-2 pennies will drop.
  When held by Keeper , it will drop 0-1 pennies instead.
longDescription.notes:
If Keeper collects this item with 1 health coin, it will heal a coin and add 2 coins to his inventory.
Unlike the coins dropped from being hit by a shot from a Keeper, Greed or Super Greed, the coins that are dropped from the piggy bank are not subtracted from Isaac's total.
Can appear in the shop and the item room on the same floor, but picking up multiple copies of the item does not cause its effect to stack.
The drops from Piggy Bank, unlike Swallowed Penny, are locked to normal pennies, instead of random types of coins.

longDescription.effects:
Adds a chance to shoot fear tears, causing enemies to run away from the player.
-1 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
 This item belongs to the Yes Mother? set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into his mother.
longDescription.notes:
The fear effect chance depends on the luck stat, reaching 100% with 85 luck.
  Dark Matter is significantly better at inflicting fear than Mom's Perfume.

longDescription.effects:
Grants a charged shot that fires 14 tears in the same fashion as Monstro.
  The attack can be released only when fully charged. Tear delay is increased by roughly 4.5x.
longDescription.notes:
20/20 / The Inner Eye / Mutant Spider: Adds 2, 5 or 7 tears to the barrage respectively.
  20/20 + The Inner Eye: 10 extra tears. 
  20/20 + Mutant Spider: 14 extra tears. 
  The Inner Eye + Mutant Spider: 14 extra tears. 
  All three: 19 extra tears.
Chemical Peel: Overridden by Monstro's Lung.
  Tears have a 50% chance to be Chemical Peel tears.
Cursed Eye: Overridden by Monstro's Lung.
 Epic Fetus: Launches 3-5 cursors that rotate around each other before the missiles land.
Epiphora: No effect. Tears stat is increased properly but firing cancels the effect.
 Kidney Stone: If Monstro's Lung is picked up while Kidney Stone is ready to fire, charge time for Monstro's Lung will be significantly decreased.
  Only stat effects from Kidney Stone apply.
Loki's Horns/Mom's Eye: Isaac will still fire single tears in the other direction(s).
 The Ludovico Technique: Tear becomes a cluster of variably sized tears spread over a small area. The tears move at the same speed when controlled but constantly move around each other.
Marked: Only stat effects from Marked apply.
My Reflection: Tears stay in the air much longer and consistently, allowing better reach and more focused blasts before they arc back.
Strange Attractor: Due to the high concentration of tears enemies will be pulled into Isaac at great force, in certain cases enough force to pull enemies through rocks.
Tech X: Fires a group of laser rings with size dependent on how long they were charged, with increased charge time.
Technology: If picked up after Technology, Monstro's Lung has no effect. Technology will override Monstro's Lung with very low tear shot.
  Charge effect is removed and fire rate returned to normal. Extra lasers will be shot in random directions around Isaac while firing.
The Wiz: 7-8 tears are fired at each diagonal direction instead of a full burst.

longDescription.effects:
+1.5 damage.
+0.2 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).
Grants 6 black hearts.
Removes all red heart containers.
  Will not remove bone hearts , but will empty them.
Adds a chance to shoot fear tears.
 This item belongs to the Leviathan set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Leviathan.
longDescription.notes:
The chance to fire a fear tear depends on Isaac's luck stat, and goes up to 100% at 85 Luck.
  Dark Matter is significantly better at inflicting fear than Abaddon.
Does not remove soul hearts or eternal hearts.
As it removes all red heart containers, other devil deals can be taken for "free" as long as Abaddon is taken last while still having at least 1 container.
Has no negative trade-off when taken as ???, except the revoked chance of an angel room.
Likewise, The Lost gets a significant speed and damage increase.
Can always be taken when offered as a 3 soul heart devil deal. Even if the player only has one or two soul hearts, six black hearts will be granted after taking the item.

longDescription.effects:
Adds a chance to shoot slowing tears, reducing the speed of enemy movement and any projectiles they fire.
Isaac leaves a trail of slowing black creep.
longDescription.notes: The probability of shooting a slowing tear depends on Isaac's luck, going up to 100% at 18 luck.
