Damage against paused multi-segmented bosses works unpredictably, most notably allowing you to damage Scolex on normally invulnerable parts.
This allows you to clear a room or do damage to a boss for 30 seconds if you have a way to deal damage without attacking, like an orbital or follower that attacks automatically.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, any trinkets that the player is holding are destroyed, and their effects are permanently applied to the player.
Increases the chance for a trinket to drop. (Has a 2% chance to turn the pickup variant into a trinket.)
longDescription.notes:
While held,Mom's Box will double the effect of all absorbed trinkets (if their effects can be doubled).
This item is able to remove the Tick.
Trinkets whose effects only activate once, such as Store Credit, Missing Poster, and Walnut, will still only activate once after being absorbed.
It is possible to see previously smelted trinkets during a victory lap, or if the trinket Item Pool is exhausted. Picking up a copy of a trinket will not duplicate that trinket's effect.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, converts pickups within the current room to blue flies or blue spiders.
Doubles Isaac's current amount of blue flies and spiders.
  If Isaac has no blue flies or spiders, spawns one blue fly or spider.
longDescription.notes: Does not work on Troll bombs or Mega Troll Bombs.

longDescription.effects:
For the current room, rotates every enemy and pickup 90 degrees and moves its sprite up and left.
  Enemy hitboxes remain the same.
Increases one of Isaac's stats and decreases another. Possible stat changes include:
   1 flat damage 
  0.5 tears 
  0.2 speed and maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0) 
  0.2 shot speed 
  1 luck 
  0.5 range
Adds random tear effects for the current room.
Distorts the music for the current room.
longDescription.notes:
The item name and description are a reference to the dataminers who discovered the secret of The Lost within 109 hours of Rebirth's release.
  The item and its pickaxe icon are a play on words on the term data mining, used in the context of gaming communities as extracting data from the game files.
The item's sprite is a recolor of the Notched Axe.
If used during the Mom fight, you will be able to see a normally hidden part of the leg sprite revealing a blue skirt with yellow polka dots.
If Dataminer is used right before traveling to the next floor, the music for the transition screen will be affected by it.
In a Q&A from Twitter, Edmund McMillen considered Dataminer to be the worst item in the Binding of Isaac.

longDescription.effects:
Transforms Isaac into a different character, at the cost of the last item collected each time the active is used.
  All stat changes of the new character are applied.
longDescription.notes:
Clicker can only transform Isaac into characters that have already been unlocked, along with Lazarus Risen and Dark Judas.
Activating Clicker typically only consumes passive items, but with Schoolbag it may consume the item in the other activated items slot, if that item was the most recently collected.
This item can remove Isaac's health if he is transformed into The Lost, and it will not be restored upon transforming into a different character.
  If The Lost is changed into Keeper , he will have two health coins with one filled. Changing from The Lost to any other character will leave them with half a soul heart. 
  When changing from The Lost, additional lives may be lost in the process, such as losing lives from Dead Cat.
Changing to ??? will remove any red heart containers. If this would leave him with no soul/black hearts, he will have half a soul heart left.
Transforming into a new character does not grant Isaac the starting items of the new character. For example, transforming into The Lost does not grant the D4 or Holy Mantle.
It is also possible for the Clicker to choose the same character as the one that is already being played as, making it seem like the item had no effect at all.
Similarly to items such as Judas' Shadow and Lazarus' Rags, any Completion Marks obtained will correspond with the character the Clicker turns you into.
Since the Clicker removes the last item collected, it is wise to use it after picking up an unwanted item.
Removed items still count towards transformations.
If Isaac changes into Eden, a token will be used.

longDescription.effects:
Destroys all obstacles in the current room and deals 200 damage to every enemy (including Bosses). This effect also applies to every room for the remainder of the floor.
  This effect only applies to rooms that have not yet been cleared. It does not destroy things in rooms that are already cleared. This means it is most powerful when used at the start of a floor.
Opens all Secret Room and Super Secret Room doors on the current floor.
longDescription.notes:
Mama Mega! opens the paths to Boss Rush and the Blue Womb in the boss rooms even after the time limits expire.
  After the bomb goes off, you may simply walk through the Boss Rush / Blue Womb door without defeating the boss first. 
  It will also open the Boss Rush / Blue Womb door if it is activated after Mom or Mom's Heart/It Lives have already been defeated. 
  Leaving the boss room (via a warp card or devil/angel deal) will close the doors. 
  Leaving the boss rush room or Blue Womb entrance room will also close the doors. 
  With Schoolbag and Diplopia , Mama Mega! can be doubled to get into both Boss Rush and the Blue Womb in the same run after the time limits expire.
Like all single-use active items, this item cannot be absorbed byVoid.
Entering a room with an angel statue while the effect is active automatically initiates a fight with an Angel.
If used with the ? Card, Mama Mega! will be activated and consumed.
Does not kill Lil' Haunts and other enemies that are immune to damage while entering the room.
If used before the Ultra Greed fight begins, it will deal no damage to Ultra Greed, as he is invulnerable for the first few seconds upon first entering his room. However, it will still break obstacles as usual.
When used in Greed Mode, it will only activate once for the main room (as opposed to once per wave, in a similar fashion to a standard run). Therefore, its damage potential is maximized if used after all the monster waves have spawned for the current floor.
Does not open the door to Mega Satan in The Chest or Dark Room.

Wait_What?.shortDescription: I can't believe it's not butter bean!

longDescription.effects: Upon use, Isaac farts, knocking back enemies and their shots. It also sends out rock waves which deal 10 damage per tick to nearby enemies and break destructibles.
longDescription.notes:
This item is identical to Butter Bean in appearance.
Butter Bean has a small chance to turn into this item upon pickup.
This item is useful for opening Secret Rooms, Super Secret Rooms, and Bedrooms. In Bedrooms, it can also open up the passage under the carpet.
  In order to break open a secret room, the wall must be hit with one of the rock waves, not the gas cloud, so Isaac needs to stand a few steps away from the wall.
The earthquake can open Stone Chests.
The earthquake can be used to explode the Donation Machine or activate a Restock Box.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, has a 50% chance to double all items, pickups, and chests in the current room.
  If the effect fails, the items, pickups, and chests disappear, and a penny is spawned.
longDescription.notes:
If used in a Shop or Devil Room, the duplicated items and pickups can be taken for free.
If the effect fails in a shop that contains a Restock Box then the Restock Box can be used to refresh the shop, bringing back new items and pickups.
If used in the Boss Rush room, it can duplicate the items, and all of them can be taken without affecting the originals. Successfully duplicating the items will trigger Boss Rush, and failing to duplicate them will not.
If used on The Polaroid and The Negative after defeating Mom, it can duplicate them, and they can both be taken without affecting the originals.
The 50% chance is predetermined after each use of Crooked Penny. By force quitting after each failure, this can be exploited to generate large numbers of copies of useful items - if the penny is going to fail, then use it in a different room, recharge it, and try again.

longDescription.effects: Hurts Isaac without taking away health, activating any items that trigger upon taking damage.
longDescription.notes: As using the Dull Razor will grant invincibility frames like normal damage, this item can be used to enter Curse Rooms or use Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars for free.

longDescription.effects:
On use:
  Removes one red heart container . 
  Increases damage by a flat +0.2. 
  Grants one Cube of Meat . 
  Grants the Anemic effect (+5 range , red creep trail).
The damage and Cube of Meat level increases stack and are permanent, but the Anemic effect will only last until Isaac exits the room.
longDescription.notes:
It is possible for Isaac to kill himself by removing his final heart container.
It is possible to generate multiple Meatboys.
Cubes of Meat given by this item do not remove any Cubes of Meat from Greed Mode item pools.
This item cannot be used on soul hearts, black hearts, bone hearts, and eternal hearts.

longDescription.effects: Grants a random item's effect for the current room.
longDescription.notes:
Beware using this as The Lost, as it can trigger self-harm items and kill him.
Using this item multiple times in the same room will replace the previous item with a new one.
Metronome cannot grant the effects of itself,Glowing Hour Glass orPlan C.

longDescription.effects:
Upon activation, this item is consumed and will vanish from Isaac's inventory.
Spawns two random item pedestals using the item pool of the current room.
longDescription.notes:
This item starts with no charges.
UnlikeMega Blast, this item can be charged with a single Little Battery.

longDescription.effects:
Spawns a stationary fly turret that shoots at enemies.
The flies are completely invulnerable and ignored by enemies.
The flies deal 2 damage per shot.
longDescription.notes:
9 Volt: Brown Nugget starts at half charge after use.
BFFS!: Flies are larger, but do not deal increased damage.
Car Battery: Two flies will be spawned instead of one.
Hive Mind: No effect.

longDescription.effects:
Damages all enemies in the room.
  The damage dealt is equal to Isaac's current tear damage plus 10% of the enemy's max health.
Has a chance to drop half red or soul hearts when it damages an enemy.
  Half red hearts will always drop when the player has at least one red heart container, otherwise half soul hearts will drop.
longDescription.notes: When used on Delirium, damage is calculated using the maximum health of the current boss it's mimicking. This item should be used when it isn't transformed to deal the most damage.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, spawns a Delirium form of a charmed boss.
Changes the appearance of the current room so it looks like a different chapter.
longDescription.notes:
If multiple bosses are spawned in one room withCar Battery or battery pickups, the bosses can try to kill each other.
Sometimes bosses don't spawn because of gridentities getting in the way. When this happens the upper door appears to have friendly particles.
UnlikeMega Blast, this item can be charged with a single Little Battery.
It is possible for Hush to spawn, despite Delirium not transforming into Hush during its boss battle.
If a boss summons monsters, the monsters will be charmed and will follow Isaac out of the room.
Delirious has a 60% decreased item pool weight, making it less likely to appear than other collectibles.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, Isaac throws a black hole which sucks in and damages enemies.
  The black hole deals 0.4 damage per tick very rapidly. This damage doesn't scale with Isaac's damage. 
  The black hole lasts for about 6 seconds. 
  The black hole also slightly sucks in Isaac and pickups. 
  The black hole also destroys nearby obstacles, such as rocks and pots. 
  It can also suck in projectiles made by enemies.
longDescription.notes:
The black hole can pull pickups across pits, so be careful as it may pull pickups to areas where they are unobtainable.
Black Hole's pull is stronger than the pull of Strange Attractor.
Black Hole does not suck in stationary enemies.

longDescription.effects: Upon use, spawns a random item from the current room's item pool, with a chance to spawn A Lump of Coal or The Poop instead.
longDescription.notes: Mystery Gift's item depends on the Luck stat.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, spawns a sprinkler that rotates and fires tears in 8 directions (cardinal and diagonal).
  The sprinkler's tears have the same stats and effects as Isaac's tears. 
  The sprinkler's rate of fire and rotation speed depend on Isaac's tears stat. 
  The sprinkler does not deal contact damage.
longDescription.notes:
20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: The sprinkler fires multiple tears simultaneously.
Angelic Prism: Any Sprinkler tears that pass through the prism will split. If the prism is held over the Sprinkler, it will constantly fire split tears.
Blood Clot: The sprinkler will fire either normal tears or tears with the Blood Clot effect depending on which tear Isaac fired last.
Brimstone: The sprinkler fires short-ranged Brimstone lasers instead of tears.
Compound Fracture/The Parasite/Cricket's Body: The sprinkler will fire tears that will split into smaller tears upon hitting obstacles or enemies.
Haemolacria: Sprinklers will shoot tears that will burst into smaller tears.
Jacob's Ladder: The sprinkler will shoot electric tears.
Lachryphagy: Sprinklers will shoot tears that can be fed and will burst.
Lead Pencil: Sprinkler tears count for activation of the Lead Pencil effect. The tear burst may fire from the sprinkler or Isaac.
Loki's Horns: The sprinkler has four eyes and simultaneously fires tears in four directions.
A Lump of Coal: Sprinkler tears do more damage based on how far they travel.
Mom's Eye: The sprinkler has two eyes and simultaneously fires tears forwards and backwards.
Mom's Knife: The sprinkler fires knives instead of tears. The knives fire straight outwards, deal double Isaac's base damage and do not return.
Monstro's Lung: The sprinkler fires disorganized clusters of tears.
Spoon Bender/Baby-Bender: The sprinkler will shoot homing tears.
Tech X: The sprinkler fires laser rings that are smaller than the central spark and have a correspondingly small hit area, though they still deal normal damage.
Technology: The sprinkler fires lasers instead of tears.
Technology Zero: The tears fired from the sprinkler will connect with electricity in a spiral formation due to the sprinkler's rotating mechanic.
Trisagion: Sprinklers will shoot beams.

longDescription.effects:
If Isaac is in a shop, devil room, or black market, upon use, makes a random item free.
While held, guarantees a random item or pickup from the shop to be half price.
longDescription.notes:
Using the Coupon in a devil room and taking that free item does not affect or remove the chances for angel rooms.
Using the Coupon in a shop while holdingRestock will not respawn a new item.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, for the next three seconds, any enemy shots that come near Isaac are held in place. After the charge is depleted, they are fired back as tears.
  The reflected tears always deal 3.5 damage.
longDescription.notes:
The tears can be rammed into enemies while they're held by Telekinesis. They won't disappear until the effect ends, but deal no further damage.
Catching shots from enemies that fire high into the air, like the Tube Worm, is very difficult and not beneficial; in the case of the Tube Worm, shots that are caught will just fall to the ground rather than be fired at enemies.

longDescription.effects:
If the box is empty, picks up all items and pickups in a room and stores them.
If the box is not empty, places all stored items and pickups in the current room.
longDescription.notes:
There is no limit to the number of items and pickups that can be held in the box.
Any stored items and pickups unpacked from Moving Box will remain identical to what was originally packed; pills, cards, and runes will stay the same, sticky nickels will remain stuck to the floor, and chests will have the same contents as they would if they had been opened immediately.
Active items keep their charge in the box.
Stealing from Shops and Devil Rooms is not possible; only items on pedestals will be packed up.
If used in a Challenge Room or a Boss Challenge Room, the objects within can be packed up without starting the challenge.
If used in a room with multiple choice item pedestals, only one of the choice objects will be packed up and the rest behave normally.
  Both items presented by There's Options and More Options can be taken. 
  Both The Polaroid and The Negative can be taken. 
  If used in the Boss Rush , one of the objects is packed up but the rush is not started. The remaining item choices start the rush as normal.
Multiple Moving Boxes can be stored in a single Moving Box, but the items inside any stored Moving Boxes transfer to the active Moving Box; items cannot be stored within Moving Boxes that are stored within Moving Boxes.

longDescription.effects:
Summons a ghost near Isaac that will follow him around, and summons a controllable blue crosshair. After a few seconds, the crosshair disappears, and the ghost will perform an action depending on what the crosshair was targeting:
  Items, pickups, trinkets, brown/red/spiked chests: Brings it to Isaac. Works in shops, devil deals and black markets as well, making them effectively free. Stealing an item has a chance to fail. If that happens a buzzer sound will play out and the ghost will disappear without doing anything. 
  Golden/eternal/stone chests: Opens the chest for free. 
  Buttons: Presses the button. 
  Enemies: Attacks the enemy until it dies or becomes untargetable due to a form change or similar. 
  Doors: Opens the door, even if it is locked. Functions the same as Dad's Key when being used in this way. This includes the door to Mega Satan , exiting Hush 's room, and exiting Boss Rush . 
  Secret room entrances: Explodes, opening the entrance. 
  Destructible obstacles , shopkeepers , machines , and beggars : Explodes and destroys them.
longDescription.notes:
When used to attack, Mr. ME! deals 3 damage per tick at a slow rate, for 9 damage per second. BFFS! does not increase the damage.
Stealing an item from a shop will restock it with another item. This happens even if Isaac does not haveRestock.
  Stealing from a black market will not restock items, as they work like devil deals.
If the crosshair is not targeting anything when the crosshair disappears, the ghost will interact with the object closest to the crosshair.
If the room has nothing to interact with, the ghost will disappear without doing anything.
The ghost cannot pick up sticky nickels, and will disappear upon touching them.
The ghost can press the button in Greed Mode, allowing waves to be stopped without taking damage.
The ghost can open chests in Challenge Rooms without triggering the room.
In rooms with multiple pedestal items where only one can be taken, if the ghost is carrying a pedestal while Isaac picks up a different pedestal item, the ghost will disappear. This prevents taking both items for free.
When used against Isaac (Boss) or ??? (Boss), the ghost will still try to chase the boss even when he flies away.

longDescription.effects:
Upon use, sacrifices up to 2 familiars and spawns an item from the Devil Room Pool for each familiar sacrificed.
  The order in which the familiars were obtained does not matter; it picks 2 at random to sacrifice. 
  If Isaac has no familiars, the item will do nothing and will not be consumed. 
  If the Devil Room Pool has no items left, one or two copies of Pentagram are spawned. 
  When playing Greed Mode the normal Devil Room Pool is still used, instead of the Greed Mode pool.
In addition to the familiars, any blue flies or spiders will be converted to 1 coin each.
longDescription.notes:
If playing as Lilith, theIncubus familiar cannot be sacrificed.
Charmed enemies cannot be sacrificed, even if permanently charmed.
Any pretty flies are counted as a single sacrifice.

longDescription.effects:
When used, spawns one of the following things for each enemy already killed in the current room:
  An orbital bone familiar (very common). 
  A friendly Bony (uncommon). 
  A friendly Black Bony (rare).
Orbital bones deal contact damage equal to Isaac's damage at the time it was spawned, repel enemies that touch it, and will block 3 shots or deal 2 ticks of contact damage before being destroyed.
Bonys deal 8.3 contact damage and 5 damage with thrown bones.
Black Bonys will explode on death, dealing 40 damage to enemies it hits. The explosion will also hurt Isaac if he is in range.
longDescription.notes:
Using the book in a room that had no enemies or was re-entered does nothing and expends the charge.
Enemy remains can be animated only once, so using the book multiple times in the same room requires more enemies to have died for it to have an effect.
Destroying Black Poop will damage the friendly Bonys acquired from this item.

longDescription.effects:
Using this on a dirt patch that appears in grave rooms will unlock The Forgotten.
  Once the Forgotten is unlocked, digging into dirt patches will instead spawn a random type of chest .
Spawns a trapdoor that leads to the next floor upon activation, identical to We Need to Go Deeper!
  Like We Need to Go Deeper! , it can occasionally spawn crawl spaces. 
  However, it does not spawn a trapdoor when used above a pit, unlike We Need to Go Deeper!
longDescription.notes:
Once Mom's Shovel is complete, the stomping caused by Broken Shovel stops.
Like We Need to Go Deeper!, this item can be used to destroy rocks if used while Isaac is flying over a rock.

longDescription.effects: Spawns one coin of any type upon taking damage.
longDescription.notes:
Swallowed Penny can also be found by destroying urns and special shopkeepers.
Though similar to the Piggy Bank item, the Swallowed Penny is not limited to just pennies.
 Unlike Piggy Bank, playing as Keeper with this trinket always drops a coin, allowing semi-infinite life.
  A trick for farming money when playing as Keeper is to find a room with some static hazard like spikes and taking damage, causing a coin to appear. A penny will only refill life, but a nickel will give four cents and a dime will give nine cents. 
  This trick can also be used to survive multiple uses of a sacrifice room, healing with the dropped coin between each sacrifice.

longDescription.effects: Increases Pickup drop rate from poops to 50%.
longDescription.notes:
Can be used when fighting bosses that spawn poop like Larry Jr. or Dingle, although the drop rate is greatly decreased in these rooms.
Very effective with A Card Against Humanity.
Not affected by Luck.

longDescription.effects: Automatically recharges the last energy slot of an activated item, effectively reducing recharge rates by one.
longDescription.notes:
Has no effect on items with only one bar of charge or those with automatic recharge.
Effect stacks with the 9 Volt.
Does not work with the second level of charge granted by The Battery.
This trinket will only take effect when the item gains its penultimate charge upon completing a room. Recharging an item by taking damage with Habit will not activate the trinket's effect.
It takes effect after Watch Battery if Watch Battery triggers and gives the item its penultimate charge.
  The same applies to the bonus charge from completing a quadruple room or L-shaped room.

longDescription.effects: Triggers the Teleport effect whenever an activated item is used.
longDescription.notes:
Upon using The Bible while fighting Mom, Isaac will get teleported out of the room before the death animation is finished, resulting in the boss room being reset.
This item can only teleport Isaac to rooms that can be shown on the map. It is not possible to teleport to the I AM ERROR room, Devil Room, Angel Room, Crawl Space, Black Market, Boss Rush, the room with the access to Blue Womb, or Mega Satan.

longDescription.effects:
Increases the chance of Challenge Rooms to be Boss Challenge Rooms.
Doubles the chance for champion enemies to appear.
longDescription.notes: In military terms, the Purple Heart is awarded to soldiers who are wounded in action.

longDescription.effects: Pulls all types of coins towards Isaac. Ignores all other items.

Increases the chance to see an Angel Room. The Angel Room chance rises from 50% (base chance) to 75%.
Increases the chance to find The Bible in the Library and Shop.
longDescription.notes:
If a Devil Deal or Black Market deal has been paid, an Angel Room will not spawn, even with Rosary Bead.
This item does not increase the chance for an Angel/Devil Room Door to spawn when a Boss is killed, unlike Goat Head or The Book Of Belial.
Despite indicating "Faith Up", there is no "Faith" stat in the game. "Faith Up" only serves to inform the player that it is linked to Angel Rooms in an unspecified way.
The chance to find The Bible in the Library is increased to 45% and the chance to find it in the Shop is increased to 13%.[1]

longDescription.effects: Grants a chance to trigger The Gamekid effect upon taking damage.
longDescription.notes: The activation chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% with 38 Luck.

longDescription.effects: Tears pulsate in size as they travel. The effect changes the hitbox of the tear, but does not affect damage.

Isaac's tears travel in a wave-like pattern.
+0.3 tears up.
  The tears up is bugged and is not applied until another item updates Isaac's tears stat.
longDescription.notes: Wiggle Worm was a passive item in the original Binding of Isaac. The likely reason for the change to a trinket is the situational usefulness of this shot pattern, along with the new ability to drop trinkets on demand.

longDescription.effects: Isaac's tears travel in a high-speed spiral pattern.
longDescription.notes: The tear pattern slightly increases Isaac's effective range.

longDescription.effects:
Gives Isaac's tears an oblong appearance.
Increases tears' natural knock-back slightly.

While holding the trinket, all items in the Shop cost 0 cents.
  After purchasing an item, the trinket disappears. 
  This trinket does not work on Devil Deals or the Black Market.
longDescription.notes: Buying a trinket while holding Store Credit will drop Store Credit without consuming it while still taking the trinket for free.

longDescription.effects: Prevents damage from creep and floor spikes.
longDescription.notes:
Does not prevent any damage from Curse Room doors.
Does not prevent damage from Greed Mode's stop button.
Prevents the use of Sacrifice Rooms, unlike flight.

longDescription.effects: Each obstacle destroyed drops one coin.
longDescription.notes: Coins from obstacles are dropped from any source that destroys them, including enemies such as the Round Worm.

longDescription.effects:
Mom's foot comes down every full minute (based on the in-game timer), dealing 300 damage.
  Still hurts Isaac for a Heart. 
  Can blast open doors.
longDescription.notes: As the foot counts as an explosion, the damage can be avoided with Pyromaniac or Host Hat.

longDescription.effects: Doubles the chance of black hearts appearing.
longDescription.notes:
Despite its pickup quote, this trinket does not alter the chance of finding Devil rooms in any way.
Black hearts are still very rare even with this trinket equipped.

longDescription.effects: Increases chance for Eternal Hearts to spawn.
longDescription.notes: Despite its pickup quote, this trinket does not alter the chance of finding Angel Rooms in any way.

longDescription.effects:
Allows Isaac to unlock all chests without using keys.
Locked doors are unaffected.
Key blocks are unaffected.
longDescription.notes: Due to the high chance of golden chests dropping and each chest containing a guaranteed collectible, this trinket is very useful once the player reaches The Chest.

longDescription.effects:
If Isaac has half a heart or less after taking damage, this trinket drops a Black Heart.
The effect can trigger up to three times, after which the trinket will disappear.
  The fingers stuck out by the paw will change to display the number of triggers left.
longDescription.notes:
The effect can trigger more than once in the same room.
The Lost will still die when carrying the trinket, with a Black Heart spawning afterwards.

longDescription.effects:
On every frame, it has a random chance to grant the effect of one of the following items/trinkets:
  The Polaroid 
  The Negative 
  A Missing Page 
  Missing Poster
If Isaac does not already have the item/trinket, then he will be given the item (but only for that particular frame). This means that Isaac has a chance to go to The Chest or the Dark Room without The Polaroid or The Negative, he has a chance to revive as The Lost upon death, and so forth.

Heart drop chances are reduced to 20%.
Key drop chances are increased. (Every time a heart would have spawned, it spawns a key instead.)
All hearts turn into black hearts, if possible. (Sometimes heart types are tied to the room, such as in certain Super Secret Rooms.)
longDescription.notes:
Objects and items such as Tinted Rocks, Red Chests, Fortune Tellers, Tarot Cards, Little C.H.A.D., Bloody Penny, or Blue Fires can't drop Black Hearts. Thus, they will still drop Soul/Red Hearts with Daemon's Tail.
All heart drops from Ace of Hearts will be black hearts.
Sources of heart drops that are reduced include cleared Rooms, Bosses, Slot Machines, Fortune Tellers, Beggars, Fires, Chests, Red Chests, Poops, Tinted Rocks, Items (Gimpy, Old Bandage, Fanny Pack), Trinkets (Bloody Penny), and Familiars Little C.H.A.D., The Relic, etc).
  Hearts that are present upon entering a room for the first time are unaffected by the reduction (for example, the ones found in Curse / Devil / Angel Rooms ), but will be converted to black hearts.
   The exceptions to this are particular Super Secret Rooms , which have the effect of forcing all heart drops to be the kind found within them. 
  The V - The Hierophant and VI - The Lovers Tarot Cards have a chance to drop one heart instead of two. The hearts they drop will not be black hearts.
   The cards drop two of their respective hearts every time.
Things that can drop pickups other than hearts will keep the same chance to drop a consumable, but with an increased chance for drops other than hearts and a decreased chance for heart drops. In particular, this increases the chances of acquiring:
  Tarot Cards & Trinkets from Fortune Tellers 
  Bombs and Keys from Tinted Rocks 
  Pills and items from Red Chests 
  Coins from Poops and Fires 
  Any pickup from Slot Machines , cleared Rooms, Beggars , Chests , and the Fanny Pack

longDescription.effects:
If Isaac dies in a Sacrifice Room while holding it, a particular puzzle piece will be displayed as cause of his death on his last will.
  Dying in a Sacrifice Room while holding it will outright unlock The Lost , regardless of current character.
 If Isaac dies while holding this trinket and has already unlocked The Lost, he will be revived as The Lost and Missing Poster will be consumed.
 If The Lost dies while holding this trinket, he will be revived in the previous room and Missing Poster will be consumed.
longDescription.notes:
The Lost will not be unlocked if the player is in a Victory Lap or RERUN.
None of the effects will occur during any Challenges.
 Even if Holy Mantle has been unlocked as one of The Lost's starting items, if any character dies while holding the Missing Poster, The Lost will not hold the Holy Mantle upon revival.
 If Gulp!,Smelter, orMarbles were used to absorb the poster, its effects will apply and can be used to unlock The Lost and respawn (but the effect still only applies once).

longDescription.effects:
Upon picking up a coin, Isaac farts, knocking back nearby enemies.
  The fart does not deal any damage or inflict poison.
Isaac has a chance to fart or poop every 30 seconds. Getting hit can also trigger the effect.
longDescription.notes: The Mysterious Candy is a chocolate laxative.

longDescription.effects:
Tears move shifting left to right forming a path of right angles.
+10 Range
longDescription.notes:
Effective range remains the same, because the range buff only compensates for the tears tracing a longer path.
Shooting with this trinket equipped when next to a wall or block may cause the tear to travel into the wall.

longDescription.effects: Increases Shot Speed by 0.5.
longDescription.notes: Whipworm is an intestinal parasite that most commonly infects dogs.

longDescription.effects: When held, Isaac has a 22.22% chance to be revived as ??? upon death. Can occur multiple times in the same run.
longDescription.notes: This trinket isn't affected by the Luck stat.

longDescription.effects: Spawns a blue fly every time Isaac takes damage.

Adds a 10% chance to shoot a poison tear, dealing damage over time when inflicted.
The activation chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% with 18 Luck.

Adds a 10% chance to shoot a piercing and spectral tear.
  The chance depends on luck and goes up to 100% at 18 luck.

Mini Mush
Odd Mushroom
Odd Mushroom
The Compass
longDescription.notes:
If the Compass effect triggers while having the Treasure Map, the Compass effect is permanent for the remainder of the floor. (Other Mushroom effects will still apply in each room with their normal odds.)
In addition to regular trinket drop sources, the Liberty Cap has a chance of dropping upon destroying a mushroom.

longDescription.effects: An umbilical cord is a tube that is connected to a fetus' stomach and is used to give nutrients, blood, and oxygen to the growing child.

Child's_Heart.shortDescription: It calls out to its brothers

longDescription.effects:
Increases the chance of a heart dropping after clearing a room.
Increases the chance of finding a heart when opening a chest.
longDescription.notes: This trinket is used in Challenge #10 (Cursed!).

longDescription.effects: Increases Damage by 2, after normal calculations but before damage multipliers.
longDescription.notes:
Normally, extra damage is reduced the more damage Isaac gets. Since Curved Horn is applied after every calculation, it will always be +2 damage.
Picking up Curved Horn while having damage multipliers, like Magic Mushroom or Cricket's Head, makes Curved Horn benefacting from the multiplier (bringing, in the case of a x1.5 multiplier, the damage it grants to +3).
Curved Horn's damage does not ignore damage reduction multipliers, such as Odd Mushroom (Damage * 0.9 - 0.4 damage down), Technology 2 (-35% damage down), and Soy Milk (-80% damage down).

longDescription.effects: Increases the chances of finding keys and golden chests.
Increases speed and maximum speed by 0.15.
Grants a secondary chance of any non-specific heart drop turning into a soul heart.
longDescription.notes: Mom's Pearl's original appearance before Booster Pack #5.

longDescription.effects:
-2 tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
longDescription.notes: The pickup quote is a tribute to the community of the original game. Due to the usefulness of the trinket in the original The Binding of Isaac it became a popular joke to consider "getting cancer" as a good thing.

longDescription.effects:
Grants a chance of increasing damage by 1.8 for the current room upon taking damage.
  The chance is affected by luck and goes up to 100% at 8 luck.
longDescription.notes: Can trigger multiple times in the same room and stack with itself or Razor Blade which provides a similar effect.

longDescription.effects:
Increases the chance of bombs dropping after clearing a room.
Increases the chance of finding bombs when opening a chest.
longDescription.notes:
Match Stick is the only trinket able to replace the Tick.
  This does not work if Isaac has Mom's Purse or Belly Button .

longDescription.effects:
+1 Luck.
33% chance to drop 1 additional Pickup when opening a golden chest, destroying a Machine, or blowing up a tinted rock.
Increases chances of getting a room clearing drop (independent of the luck stat).
longDescription.notes: Lucky Foot: The extra luck-independent chance of room clearing drops from both Lucky Toe and Lucky Foot applies only in a diminished form, unless at zero or negative luck.

longDescription.effects: If Isaac has less than one full red heart after taking damage, he will be immediately teleported to a random room.
longDescription.notes:
It is not recommended to have this item equipped during a boss fight as the boss's health will be restored to 100% if the player is teleported out of the room and returns, placing the player at a disadvantage unless he has acquired a Placenta.
Has no effect for The Lost, as being hit with Holy Mantle does not count as taking damage.

longDescription.effects:
Improves the chance of pills dropping after clearing a room.
Improves the chance of finding a pill when opening a chest.
Gives a chance of finding pills in tinted rocks
longDescription.notes: Quote is likely a reference to the song "Don't Swallow The Cap" by The National

longDescription.effects:
Increases the chance of tarot cards or playing cards dropping after clearing a room
Increases the chance of finding cards when opening a chest.
Increases the chance of finding cards from fortune telling machines.
longDescription.notes:
The Ace of Spades is often seen as the most powerful and highest card in an average 52 card deck.
The Ace of Spades is found many times on the battlefield, especially American soldiers. It was typically shown as a foreshadowing of death and war. [1]

longDescription.effects:
Grants a luck-dependent chance of being healed 1/2 a red heart upon clearing a room.
  The chance goes up to 100% at 18 luck.

Grants a chance to deal damage to all enemies in the room on being hit, similar to The Necronomicon.
The activation chance depends on the luck stat, and goes up to around 50% with very high Luck (between 50-60 luck).
longDescription.notes: This item is not triggered when a hit is absorbed by Holy Mantle, making it useless while playing with The Lost.

longDescription.effects: Gives a 50% chance to drop a Half Red Heart when money is collected.
longDescription.notes: It can be found by destroying special shopkeepers.

longDescription.effects: Gives a 50% chance to drop a bomb when money is collected.
longDescription.notes: Rarely drops from TNT barrels.

longDescription.effects: Gives a 50% chance of spawning a Key upon collecting any coin.
longDescription.notes: Flat Penny can drop out of special shopkeepers.

longDescription.effects: Every time the player picks up a coin pickup of some kind, there is a 50% chance that the player will receive an additional coin.
longDescription.notes:
In addition to regular drop options for all trinkets, this trinket can be found in golden poop, by killing a beggar, or winning at a shell game beggar.
 Counterfeit Penny can trigger from picking up a coin to heal the Keeper. Normally, a coin that heals the Keeper's coin health will not increase his penny count (Nickels give +4 and Dimes give +9), but if Counterfeit Penny triggers, he will still be healed and still get the full amount.

longDescription.effects:
Removes 15% of any enemy's health if they have over 60 HP.
Gives Isaac one red heart if he enters an uncleared Boss Room.
Once picked up, it can't be removed.
  The Tick can be replaced by Match Stick .
   The Tick cannot be replaced with the Match Stick if Isaac has Mom's Purse or Belly Button . 
  The Tick can be removed by Smelter and Gulp! .
longDescription.notes: This trinket can be used to infinitely replenish health if Isaac has access to any infinitely usable teleportation effect (such as Broken Remote + How to Jump).

longDescription.effects: Isaac's severed head will follow him as a Familiar firing piercing tears, dealing 3.5 damage with each shot.
longDescription.notes:
While holding this trinket, if there's another familiar that follows Isaac's Head, dropping this trinket will move the familiar to the first familiar slot.
  This resets upon quitting and re-entering the game. 
  This is useful with familiars that are more effective when closer to Isaac, such as Lil' Brimstone and Incubus .

longDescription.effects: Gives an Eternal Heart at the start of every floor.
longDescription.notes:
The eternal heart is added directly to Isaac's heart containers, as opposed to appearing as a pickup.
When held as ???, an eternal heart will spawn each floor. Upon completing each floor with one,??? will receive a full soul heart.
The effect will also be triggered when the floor is reset (for example, with Forget Me Now).
Since the Eternal Heart is added at the beginning of the next floor, moving from one floor to the next with an Eternal Heart looted elsewhere will give you the additional heart container plus another Eternal Heart when the next floor starts.
If held when playing as Keeper, blue flies will not be spawned instead of the eternal heart. This is because the Eternal Heart given by Maggy's Faith is directly added to Isaac's health, and not spawned as a pickup on the ground.
Eden will not be given the eternal heart on the first floor in case he starts with this trinket.

longDescription.effects: Items in the Devil Room only cost 1 Heart Container.
longDescription.notes:
Soul heart trades still cost 3 Soul hearts, rendering this item useless for ??? and The Forgotten.
Judas' Tongue can retroactively change the price of devil deals.

longDescription.effects:
1/15 chance to increase damage by 0.5 for the current room each time an enemy dies.
  Samson's Lock can activate up to 10 times per room. 
  The activation chance depends on the Luck stat, and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.
longDescription.notes:
According to the Bible, Samson was given supernatural strength by God to fight his enemies, the Philistines, and perform heroic acts; but when he was tricked into allowing his hair to be cut by a Philistine woman named Delilah, Samson was powerless.
A lock of hair is a piece(s) of hair which has been cut from a human head, typically being held together in some manner.
This trinket is a reference to the effect of Bloody Lust (Samson's starting item) in the original game, which was later changed in Rebirth and added in Afterbirth as the item Lusty Blood.

longDescription.effects:
When starting a floor, 25% chance to get the The Compass effect for the duration of a floor.
  The chance increases based on the luck stat, and maxes out at 100% at 3 luck.
longDescription.notes: Cain's Eye's appearance was changed in Booster Pack #5.

longDescription.effects:
5% chance to spawn a Dead Bird familiar for the current room each time an enemy dies.
  The Dead Bird deals 4 damage per second. 
  The chance increases with luck , reaching 100% at 8 luck.
longDescription.notes:
This trinket alone cannot spawn more than one Dead Bird per room. It can, however, stack with Dead Bird to spawn two in one room.
The bird familiar spawned by this trinket is transparent and has one missing leg compared to the one spawned by the actual item.

The_Left_Hand.shortDescription: The left-hand path reaps dark rewards

longDescription.effects: Replaces every type of chest with Red Chests.
longDescription.notes:
The effect includes chests already spawned. Entering a room that previously contained other types of chests while holding The Left Hand will turn them into Red Chests permanently.
It is advised to drop The Left Hand (by holding either CTRL key for few seconds, holding R2 or RT for 3 seconds on PS4 and Vita and Xbox One, respectively, or holding ZR on the New Nintendo 3DS / Nintendo Switch for a few seconds) before entering The Chest, as it will convert the golden chests there which always contain items.
  The player may prefer red chests for their possible Soul Hearts or red chest items, at the expense of guaranteed items.
The Left Hand with Guppy's Tail causes all Gold Chests it would usually drop to be Red Chests instead.

longDescription.effects: Tinted rocks and rocks with Crawl Spaces will flash white every 10 seconds.

Troll Bombs turn into Bomb pickups before they explode.
Mega Troll Bombs turn into 1+1 Free Bombs before they explode.
longDescription.notes:
Players can farm large amounts of bomb pickups if used against Little Horn, War, Pride, or other Troll Bomb spawning enemies.
Does not affect Wrath's bombs.
  Wrath and Super Wrath 's bombs turn into their respective pickups.

longDescription.effects:
Isaac's tears gain a worm trinket effect that changes every 3 seconds of the in-game timer. The effects include:
  Pulse Worm 
  Ring Worm 
  Tape Worm 
  Whip Worm 
  Wiggle Worm 
  Flat Worm 
  Hook Worm 
  Lazy Worm
The order of the effects is always as above, in a cycle.
longDescription.notes: This trinket is used in Challenge #28 (PRIDE DAY!).

longDescription.effects:
x2 range.
x0.5 tear height.
longDescription.notes:
Increases Azazel's Brimstone range as well, but doesn't double it.
Causes Dr. Fetus to shoot bombs very fast and far.
Only tear height affectsIncubus and Fate's Reward, usually lowering effective range.
Reduces the effective range of Ipecac shots.

longDescription.effects:
-0.40 Shot Speed.
+4.0 Range up.
+2.0 Tear Height.
longDescription.notes: Piercing tears - Tears will hit enemies multiple times in one shot.

longDescription.effects:
When Isaac takes damage, there is a chance of a random dice effect occurring, including:
  The D6 
  D8 
  D12 
  D20
longDescription.notes: This trinket can be used in conjunction with the IV Bag or a blood donation machine to generate unlimited pickups and items.

longDescription.effects:
Pickups and enemies are attracted to Isaac.
  The attraction enables pickups to pass over pits and rocks, but not through Key Blocks. 
  Hearts are only attracted if Isaac could pick them up with his existing heart containers.
longDescription.notes:
While fighting Ultra Greed, the doors are affected by the magnet as well.
Does not pull other trinkets.
If the player has The Ludovico Technique while also holding the Super Magnet, the speed at which the tear slowly crawls nearer to you is increased.
One tactic for using the Super Magnet is to drop it in the floor's starting room and come back for it once rooms are cleared. This allows it to be used to attract unreachable pickups without the downside of attracting enemies.

longDescription.effects:
Occasionally causes Isaac to blend into the ground, which briefly confuses all enemies in the room.
  The confusion is only applied once everytime Isaac starts fading into the background. Therefore, any enemy that spawns while Isaac is in that state will not be confused until Isaac fades in, then out again.
longDescription.notes:
This is a possible reference to the old Binding of Isaac, in which The Polaroid was a trinket instead of an item.
It is also a possible reference to the first Back to the Future film.

longDescription.effects: Occasionally spawns a Blue Spider.
longDescription.notes: The phrase "Itchy, tasty..." is a reference to the Keeper's Diary from Resident Evil. The Diary describes the slow transformation of a researcher into a zombie as his entries become less and less coherent due to neural decay caused by t-Virus infection. His final entry consists of two words: "Itchy. Tasty.".

longDescription.effects: Bombs leave green creep underneath themselves.
longDescription.notes: Bombs will leave a trail of creep when moved or pushed around.

longDescription.effects:
Increases the chance of a Little Battery pickup after clearing a room by 6.67%.
Increases the chance of random pickups being a Little Battery by 2%.
Has a 5% chance to add an extra charge to Isaac's activated item upon completing a room.
longDescription.notes: Jumper Cables - Pick up any 3 of the following items/trinkets in a single run: 9 Volt, The Battery, Car Battery, AAA Battery, Watch Battery.

longDescription.effects: Upon exploding, bombs have a very small chance to drop a bomb pickup.
longDescription.notes: With a gold bomb and a lot of patience, an infinite number of bombs can be generated.

longDescription.effects: Gives rocks an additional chance to reveal a Crawl Space when broken.
longDescription.notes:
Stud Finder's effect is applied when a rock is destroyed and does not depend on the rock's location.
  Any of the rocks already seen before picking up Stud Finder can be affected by the trinket. 
  Shiny Rock doesn't synergize with Stud Finder as there is no set location for the rocks that will reveal a Crawl Space when destroyed with Stud Finder. 
  Unlike Tinted Rocks and normal Crawl Space rocks whose generation is dependent to the room they're in, Stud Finder's Crawl Space generation effect mainly depends on the number of rocks destroyed, which means that the more rocks destroyed, the higher the chance to find a Crawl Space.
The chance increases withMom's Box.

longDescription.effects: Gives a random trinket effect each room.
longDescription.notes:
Each room is locked to a single trinket effect, meaning that even if Isaac exits and re-enters a room, that room will always have the same trinket effect.
In rooms where the Tick effect is given, Isaac is unable to swap Error with another trinket.
If the Store Credit effect is given in a shop, all items will be free and Error will not be consumed.
If the Monkey Paw effect is given, the fingers will not count down and you will continue to get black hearts indefinitely.
If the Walnut effect is given, the trinket will not be consumed and will continue to spawn items upon taking damage.
  Touching a Stoney and Pushable TNT counts as taking damage and will spawn a lot of items.

longDescription.effects: Chests have a 50/50 chance to either drop extra consumables or pay out with nothing (or flies).
Increases the knockback of Isaac's tears.
longDescription.notes: This trinket is useful against chasing enemies and enemies that explode upon death such as Mullibooms or Boom Flies.

longDescription.effects: Increases the time that status effects stay on enemies.
longDescription.notes: The Bean / The Black Bean / Contagion: The poison duration from these items is not affected by Second Hand.

longDescription.effects: When you use a consumable item like a pill or card, there is a very small chance to spawn another one of the same type.
longDescription.notes: Endless Nameless is especially useful when used with item multiplier playing cards.

longDescription.effects:
Increases Isaac's damage by 0.2 for each of the following items or trinkets he possesses:
  Abaddon 
  Black Candle 
  Black Lipstick 
  Ceremonial Robes 
  Daemon's Tail 
  Goat Head 
  Match Book 
  Missing Page 2 
  Safety Pin
longDescription.notes: Having more than one of the same item will still increase its damage.

longDescription.effects: Makes invincibility last longer after getting hit.
longDescription.notes:
This item makes it possible to use the blood donation machine twice without taking damage the second time.
This item makes it possible to use the Devil beggar three times without taking damage the second and third times.

longDescription.effects:
+15% chance for a Treasure Room with two items to spawn on subsequent floors.
  Only one of the two items can be taken, the other will disappear.
Shops can be opened without using keys.
longDescription.notes: Keeper starts with this trinket after he defeats Satan.

longDescription.effects:
Prevents Greed and Super Greed from appearing in Shops and Secret Rooms.
Increases the chance of coin drops when clearing rooms, at the expense of heart drops.
longDescription.notes: If Rib of Greed is picked up after a Greed fight in a Shop, reentering the room will turn the room into a regular shop with items for sale.

longDescription.effects:
Donating to a donation machine has a chance to heal Isaac for a full red heart or spawn a beggar.
Increases the chance that donating to a Donation Machine will increase Isaac's luck.
longDescription.notes: The Symbol is a Triskelion, also known as a Triskele, which is often used to represent karma.

longDescription.effects: Spawns one or more blue flies from every poop Isaac destroys.
longDescription.notes: Lil Larva's original appearance before Booster Pack #5.

longDescription.effects:
Grants half a red heart each time a key is used.
Turns half red hearts on the ground into full red hearts.
longDescription.notes:
Having a Golden Key will render the trinket unable to grant half hearts from keys until the next floor.
Having Mom's Locket while playing Keeper will restore a full health coin when a key is used.

longDescription.effects: Prevents activated collectibles from being generated, if possible, from all item pools while this trinket is being held.
longDescription.notes:
Activated items will start appearing again once the item pool's non-activated items are exhausted or getting very low.
When the trinket is dropped, the item generation mechanics go back to normal, and active items will be generated normally again.
Has no effect on Libraries until all the books have been collected, as the library pool consists only of activated items.
Fixed boss drops and machines are not affected by NO!:
  Yum Heart from Super Lust 
  Mr. Boom from Wrath 
  Anarchist Cookbook from Pride 
  Shoop Da Whoop! from Envy 
  Bob's Rotten Head from Sloth 
  A Pony and White Pony from Horsemen 
  Head of Krampus from Krampus 
  IV Bag from blood donation machine 
  Crystal Ball from fortune teller
In runs where many items have been collected/rerolled, the trinket can function as a sort-of warning to the player that an item pool will soon be exhausted if activated items begin to show up.

longDescription.effects: Causes Isaac's Familiars to stay closer to Isaac.
longDescription.notes: The pickup quote is a reference to the saying "Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer".

longDescription.effects: Destroying poop causes it to explode. The detonation range is equal to a bomb.
longDescription.notes: Red Poops will not explode when destroyed.

longDescription.effects:
Adds a chance for poop to turn into black poop.
Adds a chance for black poops to drop a Black Heart upon being destroyed.
longDescription.notes: Not affected by Luck.

longDescription.effects:
-20% tear delay (increased rate of fire)
  Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate. 
  Tear delay decreases are only noticeable when the tears stat is high.
Boosts speed, range, shot speed and damage if they are above their base values.
  Affects stat bonuses from passive items, trinkets that are absorbed or in a second trinket slot and permanent bonuses given by items such as Void . 
  The extra stat upgrades are approximately 33% of the original.
longDescription.notes:
The trinket does nothing for the listed boostable stats if they are at or below the base value; the boost is calculated on the total bonus, not per item.
Luck is not affected.

longDescription.effects:
Gives the Skatole effect only in certain rooms; this chance is based on the room itself and re-entering rooms does not affect whether the effect triggers or not.
  Attack , Dart and Ring Flies become Black Flies . 
  Pooters and Super Pooters do not shoot. 
  Boom Flies move slower.
Dropping the trinket will not revert Black Flies, but will undo the other benefits.
Many items and trinkets that generate blue flies, blue spiders or locusts will generate twice as many.
longDescription.notes: Flies may spawn on top of each other, appearing as a single fly initially.

longDescription.effects:
Adds a chance to fire a black tooth that poisons enemies.
  Black teeth deal double Isaac's normal tear damage. 
  The chance scales with luck very slowly, with barely noticeable increase until close to 30 luck, and at 32 luck every tear is a tooth.

Tears travel in a large spiral pattern.
Grants spectral tears.
+4.0 range.
+2.0 tear height.
A luck-based chance for a homing shot, reaching 100% at 9 luck.
  The homing shots are not different in appearance. 
  The homing does not override the spiral pattern, making them still unreliable.
longDescription.notes: Tractor Beam: The tears follow a straight path, ignoring the spiral pattern, the tears also stall at a specific point giving a greater chance to land tears.

longDescription.effects:
Adds a chance to fire a booger which sticks to an enemy and damages it.
  The booger tears deal their damage once per second. 
  Multiple boogers can stick to one enemy to deal extra damage. 
  The booger lasts for 60 seconds or until the enemy dies. 
  The boogers will home in on enemies.
longDescription.notes:
Nose Goblin's effect is almost identical toSinus Infection beyond the added homing effect. Consequently all its synergies apply to Nose Goblin.
Not affected by Luck.

longDescription.effects: Adds a chance to fire tears that bounce off of enemies and obstacles.
longDescription.notes: Bob's Rotten Head: The head will bounce off walls at high speeds when thrown.

longDescription.effects:
Increases all stats while Isaac's active item is fully charged:
  +0.25 speed 
  +0.75 range 
  +0.20 tears 
  +0.10 shot speed 
  +0.50 damage 
  +1 luck
longDescription.notes:
The trinket has no effect if Isaac has no active item.
Active items that are reusable indefinitely without a charge bar, such as How to Jump, will allow Vibrant Bulb's effects to be permanent (until the active item is swapped out).
Vibrant Bulb is slightly less than half as powerful as Dim Bulb; however, its effects are active more often.
Glowing Hour Glass, when used, will not make the Vibrant Bulb inactive and will still provide the bonus until it has one bar of charge.
Having additional charge beyond full with The Battery does not provide additional bonus.
If two active items are held (Schoolbag), the one currently active must be at full charge for the trinket to take effect (the other need not be).

longDescription.effects:
Increases all stats while Isaac's active item is completely uncharged:
  +0.50 speed 
  +1.50 range 
  +0.40 tears 
  +0.30 shot speed 
  +1.5 damage 
  +2 luck
longDescription.notes:
If Isaac's active item has no charge bar and can used anytime, like How to Jump, Dim Bulb's effects will be permanent.
Dim Bulb is more than twice as powerful as Vibrant Bulb; however, its effects are active less frequently.
Dim Bulb has no effect when no active item is held.
If the player has 2 items (viaSchoolbag), only 1 of them needs to be empty to receive the benefits.
  This appears to have been patched out on PC. However, if one of your two active items has no charge bar (e.g. Remote Detonator ), you can swap to it after using the charged item to preserve the Bulb's effect.

longDescription.effects:
Makes two Secret Rooms spawn upon entering a new floor with this trinket.
Has no effect in Greed Mode.
longDescription.notes: The trinket is a torn card of XVIII - The Moon.

longDescription.effects: Turn pickups into their doubled versions while Isaac's coins, bombs, and keys are equal in number.
longDescription.notes:
Upon picking up a non-doubled pickup that makes Isaac's pickups equal in number, a doubled variant will be spawned in addition.
Doubled pickups will not revert if Isaac's pickups become unequal.
This also affects Greed Mode by doubling the coin pickups generated at the start of waves and doubles keys and red hearts in the shop, making them free.

longDescription.effects: Taking damage has a small chance to destroy the trinket and spawn a random item using the item pool of the current room.
longDescription.notes: Smelter: Can spawn items when damaged multiple times.

longDescription.effects: Taking damage has a small chance to destroy the trinket and spawn Lunch.
Increases the radius of all creep produced by Isaac and his familiars.

Red heart damage will be taken before soul and black heart damage.
  With bone hearts , red hearts contained within the bone hearts will be taken before regular red heart damage, but the bone hearts will not be fully depleted. 
  If Isaac only has half a red heart left, soul and black heart damage will be taken, and bone hearts can be destroyed.
longDescription.notes:
This is useful for getting into Boss Challenge Rooms when you have soul/black hearts with more than one filled red heart container.
Red heart damage taken via the trinket affects your Devil/Angel deal chances normally.
  As a result, this trinket basically makes soul/black hearts useless at protecting Devil/Angel deal chances. Consider dropping it until you beat the boss room, and come back for it later for Boss Challenge Room access.
Reducing your total hearts to one half heart does not activate Scapular unless you no longer have soul and black hearts remaining.

Walnut.shortDescription: That's a hard nut to crack!

longDescription.effects:
When the player takes damage from an explosion, it has a chance to be destroyed and spawn various pickups. These may include:
  Coins 
  Hearts 
  Keys 
  Random trinket
longDescription.notes: Smelter: Walnut will still only activate once after being absorbed.

longDescription.effects:
Stops orbital familiars from rotating around Isaac.
Stops shooting familiars from moving.
longDescription.notes:
Familiars are stopped in the exact position they are when Duct Tape is picked up. Position of familiars can be changed by dropping Duct Tape and picking it up again.
Blue Flies orbiting Isaac move less relative to Isaac.
Many familiars, especially those that can move freely through the room, are not affected by Duct Tape, including:
  ???'s Soul 
  7 Seals 
  Abel 
  Angry Fly 
  Ball of Bandages : At level 3 and 4. 
  BBF 
  Big Chubby : Will still charge forward slowly but return to the same spot each time. 
  Bob's Brain : Will still charge forward slowly but return to the same spot each time. 
  Bumbo 
  Bum Friend 
  Cain's Other Eye 
  Cube of Meat : At level 3 and 4. 
  Daddy Longlegs 
  Dark Bum 
  Dead Bird 
  Finger! 
  Gemini : Will stay in place relative to Isaac, but the effect of chasing enemies still persists. 
  Guppy's Hair Ball 
  Jaw Bone : Will still charge forward slowly but return to the same spot each time. 
  Key Bum 
  King Baby 
  Leech 
  Lil Delirium : Depending on the form it takes. 
  Lil Gurdy 
  Lil Haunt 
  Little Chubby : Will still charge forward slowly but return to the same spot each time. 
  Lost Fly 
  Mom's Toenail 
  Multidimensional Baby 
  Obsessed Fan 
  Papa Fly 
  Pointy Rib 
  The Peeper 
  Punching Bag 
  Robo-Baby 2.0 
  Samson's Chains 
  Shade 
  Sissy Longlegs 
  Smart Fly : Fly will stay in place when orbiting Isaac but will still pursue enemies. 
  Spider Mod 
  Succubus 
  YO LISTEN!

longDescription.effects: Shops appear in The Womb, Utero, and Scarred Womb.
longDescription.notes: This trinket must already be held upon starting the Womb/Utero/Scarred Womb floor for the effect to take place, i.e., the trinket needs to be carried over from the previous floor.

longDescription.effects: Treasure Rooms appear in The Womb, Utero, and Scarred Womb.
longDescription.notes:
This trinket must already be held upon starting the Womb/Utero/Scarred Womb floor for the effect to take place, i.e., the trinket needs to be carried over from the previous floor.
XL Womb, Utero and Scarred Womb will have 2 treasure rooms, as any other XL floor.

longDescription.effects: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a Red Locust which detonates upon impact with enemies, dealing double tear damage for the impact of the Locust and 60 damage for the explosion.
longDescription.notes:
This trinket can be dangerous to hold, as the locust will instantly target the nearest enemy as Isaac enters the room, which can be close enough to catch Isaac in its blast radius.
The explosion takes most bomb effects from items that Isaac has, with some exceptions.
  The Locust does not gain additional explosion damage or radius from Mr. Mega . 
  The explosion damage is halved to 30 by Bomber Boy without additional explosions. 
  Mini bombs from Scatter Bombs are not spawned. 
  Pickups will not spawn with Glitter Bombs .
The Locust will also spawn each time a wave in Boss Rush starts.

longDescription.effects: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a Green Locust that deals double Isaac's damage and poisons enemies, which deals double Isaac's damage over time.
longDescription.notes:
The Locust will also spawn each time a wave in Boss Rush starts.
During Greed Mode, locusts will not spawn when waves start.

longDescription.effects: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a Yellow Locust that deals double Isaac's damage and slows enemies.
longDescription.notes:
The Locust will also spawn each time a wave in Boss Rush starts.
During Greed Mode, locusts will not spawn when waves start.

longDescription.effects: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a Black Locust that deals quadruple Isaac's damage, applied as two hits of double damage.
longDescription.notes:
The Locust will also spawn each time a wave in Boss Rush starts.
The Locust will not spawn each time a wave in Greed Mode starts.
If the player has exited the game, the Locust will spawn upon continuing from the main menu, allowing multiple locusts to spawn for the same room by repeatedly exiting.

longDescription.effects: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns 2-5 White Locusts that deal double Isaac's damage.
longDescription.notes:
The Locusts will also spawn each time a wave in Boss Rush starts.
The Locusts will not spawn each time a wave in Greed Mode starts.

longDescription.effects: Upon killing an enemy, has a chance to grant flight for the rest of the room.
longDescription.notes: Destroying a shopkeeper counts as a kill.

longDescription.effects: Heals for half a heart upon traveling to the next floor.
longDescription.notes: A Stem Cell is an undifferentiated cell of a multicellular organism that is capable of giving rise to indefinitely more cells of the same type, and from which certain other kinds of cell arise by differentiation.

longDescription.effects:
Fully recharges Isaac's active item upon entering a boss fight.
  This effect only occurs the first time a boss fight is entered; leaving and re-entering the boss room will not result in more recharges.
longDescription.notes:
It will fully charge any active item, even 12 room charge items like Mega Blast.
If a floor has the Curse of the Labyrinth, the item will fully charge twice; once for each boss room.
Does not work in Greed Mode.

longDescription.effects:
Grants a Holy Mantle shield upon entering a new floor, which protects against one hit of damage.
  If lost, the shield does not recharge until entering the next floor.
longDescription.notes:
The shield granted by Wooden Cross takes priority over the Holy Mantle's shield and can allow two nullified hits of damage upon first entering a floor when paired with Holy Mantle.
Bosses are generally more difficult than regular rooms, meaning that it is often wise, especially when playing as The Lost, to immediately drop the Wooden Cross at the start of new floors, then clear rooms until the Boss Room can be entered, and finally backtrack to pick up and use the Wooden Cross.

longDescription.effects:
Using an active item will drop it onto a pedestal on the ground.
When Isaac takes damage, there is a 2% chance one of Isaac's passive items will drop on the ground.
longDescription.notes: Void: Items that are normally unusable when holding Butter! can still activate their effects if absorbed by Void.

longDescription.effects: Angels drop items from the Angel Room item pool instead of key pieces when defeated.
longDescription.notes:
Items are dropped even if both key pieces are already acquired.
The fallen angels that spawn during the Mega Satan fight do not drop items.
The angels that spawn during the Boss Rush do not drop items.
Angels rarely found in closets in the Cathedral do not drop items, but ones found in Super Secret Rooms do.
Mom's Box does not cause Angels to spawn 2 items.
If both angels are being fought at the same time, only 1 item will be acquired.

longDescription.effects: While held, the last door Isaac went through stays open, allowing him to leave the room even if enemies are in it.
longDescription.notes:
This allows Isaac to leave boss rooms if the fight goes poorly.
  This becomes particularly useful in The Void , where Isaac can enter a boss room and freely exit. This is useful if the player wants to just reach Delirium , and conversely, can also be used to escape from the Delirium fight if the player needs more time/items to prepare.
If a Devil Room has a Krampus fight in it, Isaac may choose not to fight him and leave.
If an Angel fight is started in an Angel Room the door will close and prevent leaving despite the Door Stop.
If Greed spawns in a Secret Room or Shop, Door Stop can be used to leave and come back to fight Greed again to potentially get multiple Steam Sales.
Has no effect on Mom's boss room.
Can be used to reset Holy Mantle shield. Very useful playing as The Lost.
If a Locust trinket is equipped as well, can be used to spawn an unlimited amount of locusts by repeatedly entering and exiting a room with enemies in it.
If a room contained champion enemies, upon leaving and re-entering the room, all previous champion enemies will have turned to regular enemies.

longDescription.effects:
Beams of yellow electricity flow between Isaac and his familiars, damaging any enemies between them.
  The beams do 6 points of damage per strike.
longDescription.notes:
The Forgotten's Soul acts as a familiar with this item.
Does not affect temporary familiars.

longDescription.effects: Spawns a blue fly every time a coin is picked up.
longDescription.notes: Rotten Penny is based on this Steam Workshop item by Eufuu.

longDescription.effects: Grants Isaac's familiars homing shots.
longDescription.notes: Baby-Bender is based on this Steam Workshop item by Ink Toodles and Del.

longDescription.effects: Grants a 2% chance[1] to gain a Bone Heart upon taking damage.
